title: Cryptoverse: Big investors edge back to bitcoin
subheadlines: Big investors are dipping their toes into crypto waters again after a bumper month for bitcoin.

title: Dollar clings to gains after U.S. data; traders eye Fed next week
subheadlines: The dollar clung to modest gains against the euro on Friday after data showed falling U.S. consumer spending and cooling inflation, and as investors awaited a slew of central bank meetings next week.

title: Dollar higher as strong U.S. data backs a hawkish Fed
subheadlines: The dollar edged higher against the euro on Thursday after data showed the U.S. economy maintained a strong pace of growth in the fourth quarter, backing the case for the U.S. Federal Reserve to maintain its hawkish stance for longer.

title: Industry body clarifies what happens when crypto derivatives crash
subheadlines: An industry body set out a global framework on Thursday for trading derivatives linked to cryptoassets to avoid FTX-style collapses sowing confusion over ownership.

title: Dollar eases as traders look to central banks for cues
subheadlines: The dollar slipped against the euro on Wednesday, but its losses were capped as traders were hesitant to make any big bets ahead of next week's central bank meetings, including the Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank.

title: Grayscale would appeal lawsuit against SEC if court rejects case, CEO says
subheadlines: Crypto asset manager Grayscale Investments is gearing up for a prolonged legal fight with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to create a spot bitcoin exchange-traded fund, the company’s chief executive officer said.

title: IMF visit in focus after El Salvador bond payment
subheadlines: El Salvador cleared a $600 million bond payment hurdle this week but lingering concerns over its financing sources and fiscal policy will be in focus as the country prepares for an annual visit from the International Monetary Fund.

title: FBI says N. Korea-related hacker group behind U.S. crypto firm heist
subheadlines: A hacker group associated with North Korea, the Lazarus Group, also known as APT38, was responsible for the theft last June of $100 million from U.S. crypto firm Harmony's Horizon bridge, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said on Monday.

title: Cryptoverse: Bitcoin investors take control
subheadlines: Paranoid? The domino downfall of FTX and other crypto custodians is enough to make the most trusting investor grab their bitcoin and shove it under the mattress.

title: Dollar slips as upbeat euro zone business activity data lifts euro
subheadlines: The dollar edged lower against the euro on Tuesday after data showed euro zone business activity made a surprise return to modest growth in January, while U.S. business activity shrank for a seventh straight month.

title: Exclusive: Binance moved $346 mln for seized crypto exchange Bitzlato
subheadlines: Bitzlato's founder was arrested by U.S. authorities last week for allegedly running a "money laundering engine."

title: El Salvador says it has repaid $800 million bond maturing January
subheadlines: El Salvador has repaid an $800 million bond, Finance Minister Alejandro Zelaya said on Monday, the same day the bond was set to mature, as the Central American country faced pressure to make progress in cutting debt.

title: Dollar edges lower vs euro on ECB rate hike bets
subheadlines: The dollar slipped against the euro on Monday, at one point hitting a fresh 9-month low, as the common currency found support from European Central Bank officials' comments signalling additional jumbo interest rate rises in Europe.

title: U.S. Supreme Court spurns attorney-client privilege fight in crypto tax probe
subheadlines: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday threw out a case about the scope of attorney-client privilege involving a law firm's bid to withhold records from prosecutors related to a cryptocurrency-promoting client in a tax investigation.

title: Bitcoin rises 2.3% to $23,199
subheadlines: Bitcoin rose 2.3% to $23,199 at 10:07 GMT on Saturday, adding $521 to its previous close.

title: Dollar ends up vs yen, as super easy BOJ policy seems here for a while
subheadlines: Profit taking dampened a dollar surge against the yen on Friday, but the buck ended higher and still logged the biggest weekly gain since early December, as the Japanese currency remained on the defensive after the Bank of Japan governor repeated that the central bank will maintain its ultra-loose monetary policy.

title: Bitcoin rises 6.2 percent to $22,401
subheadlines: Bitcoin rose 6.24 % to $22,401 at 22:07 GMT on Friday, adding $1,315 to its previous close.

title: Crypto lending unit of Genesis files for U.S. bankruptcy
subheadlines: The lending unit of crypto firm Genesis filed for U.S. bankruptcy protection on Thursday, owing creditors at least $3.4 billion after being toppled by a market rout along with exchange FTX and lender BlockFi.

title: Factbox: The many companies in Digital Currency Group's crypto empire
subheadlines: U.S. crypto company Digital Currency Group (DCG) is at the center of the industry's latest meltdown after the lending arm of one of its companies, Genesis, froze customer redemptions in November.

title: Factbox: Crypto's string of bankruptcies
subheadlines: The lending unit of U.S. crypto firm Genesis filed for U.S. bankruptcy protection on Thursday, the latest company toppled by a market rout last year that wiped about $1.3 trillion off the value of crypto tokens.

title: Who is Barry Silbert, the head of Genesis-owner DCG?
subheadlines: As an investment banker, Barry Silbert worked on some of the highest-profile corporate failures. Now, as founder of venture capital firm Digital Currency Group, parent of troubled crypto firm Genesis, he is grappling with problems closer to home.

title: Factbox: FACTBOX The many companies in Digital Currency Group's crypto empire
subheadlines: U.S. crypto company Digital Currency Group (DCG) is at the center of the industry's latest meltdown after one of its companies, Genesis, froze customer withdrawals in November.

title: Davos 2023: Cowed crypto crowd feel winter freeze at WEF
subheadlines: In the snow and ice on the main drag in Davos, the impact of the crypto winter is plain for WEF attendees to see.

title: Crypto news site CoinDesk hires banker to explore potential sale
subheadlines: Crypto outlet CoinDesk Inc is exploring a full or partial sale of its business and has hired investment bank Lazard Ltd to lead the process, the media company's chief executive said on Wednesday.

title: Treasury yields fall after U.S. data, stocks decline
subheadlines: U.S. 10-year Treasury yields fell to a four-month low on Wednesday as data showed U.S. retail sales declined more than expected in December, while the yen was weaker against the dollar in the wake of the Bank of Japan's decision to maintain ultra-low interest rates.

title: DAVOS 2023 Crypto collapse brings focus to digital assets' 'true value' - ex-India central bank governor
subheadlines: The collapse in the prices of digital assets over the past year will allow investors to focus on the "true value" of this new technology, the distributed ledger and the smart contracts that can be built on them, former Reserve Bank of India Governor Raghuram Rajan said on Wednesday.

title: Crypto exchange Coinbase to halt Japan operations
subheadlines: Coinbase Global Inc is halting its operations in Japan due to volatile market conditions, the cryptocurrency exchange said on Wednesday, days after it announced job cuts amid waning demand for digital assets.

title: Media startup Semafor plans buyout of Sam Bankman-Fried's investment, NYT reports
subheadlines: Semafor is planning to buy out FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried's roughly $10 million investment in the news startup, the New York Times reported on Wednesday, citing the company's chief executive officer.

title: FTX reports $415 mln in hacked crypto, Bankman-Fried says FTX US is solvent
subheadlines: Bankrupt crypto exchange FTX said in a report to creditors on Tuesday that about $415 million in cryptocurrency had been stolen in hacks.

title: Dollar weakens vs yen ahead of BOJ; stocks fall
subheadlines: The dollar weakened against the Japanese yen on Tuesday amid expectations of a possible policy shift at the Bank of Japan, while stocks on Wall Street mostly fell following disappointing quarterly results from Goldman Sachs.

title: Cryptoverse: Bitcoin is back with a bonk
subheadlines: Bitcoin is on the charge in 2023, dragging the crypto market off the floor and electrifying bonk, a new meme coin.

title: Cryptocurrency past is prologue: before and after FTX
subheadlines: John Bandler of Bandler Law Firm PLLC discusses key events in the development of cryptocurrency, from the wild west to law and regulations, and explains what is needed now given that it is here to say.

title: German online bank N26 to expand crypto trading
subheadlines: German online bank N26 said on Tuesday that it would expand the list of countries where its customers may trade cryptocurrencies to include those in Germany and Switzerland.

title: Davos 2023: Scaramucci's SkyBridge bets on $35k bitcoin, targets credit
subheadlines: SkyBridge Capital is betting on a sustained turnaround in cryptocurrency markets in 2023, the firm's founder Anthony Scaramucci said, while admitting this view was "overly bullish".

title: Bitcoin rises 5.6% to $21,044
subheadlines: Bitcoin rose 5.58% to $21,044 at 2344 GMT on Saturday, adding $1,113 to its previous close.

title: Bitcoin climbs above $20,000 first time in over two months
subheadlines: Bitcoin rose on Saturday above $20,000 for first time in over two months.

title: Miss El Salvador dons golden bitcoin outfit at beauty pageant
subheadlines: A Miss Universe contestant from El Salvador strutted onto stage this week wearing a bitcoin-inspired gold bodysuit, a glittering tribute to her country becoming the world's first to adopt the crypto-currency as legal tender two years ago.

title: Investors jump into equities and bonds in Goldilocks scenario - BofA
subheadlines: Investors poured money into equity and bond funds and moved money out of gold in the week to Wednesday, according to BofA Global Research, taking heart from a string of positive data points and policy changes.

title: Bitcoin rises 6% to $19,005
subheadlines: Bitcoin rose 6% to $19,005 at 21:04 GMT on Thursday, adding $1,075 to its previous close.

title: Dollar slides to nearly 9-month low vs euro after U.S. inflation data
subheadlines: The dollar tumbled to a nearly nine-month low against the euro on Thursday after data showed U.S. inflation was easing, prompting bets that the Federal Reserve will be less aggressive with rate hikes going forward.

title: Salvadoran lawmakers pass digital asset issuance law in bitcoin haven
subheadlines: El Salvador, which became the first country in the world to recognize bitcoin as a legal tender two years ago, approved on Wednesday a law that would regulate the issuance of other digital assets by both the state and private entities.

title: Hong Kong set to shortlist crypto tokens for retail trading
subheadlines: Hong Kong securities watchdog will propose a subset of tokens it would allow for retail investors' trading, its chief executive said on Wednesday, as it presses on with a new regulatory regime that will make the city more friendly to crypto startups.

title: Venom, Iceberg set up $1 bln fund to invest in blockchain firms amid crypto winter
subheadlines: Blockchain firm Venom Foundation and Abu Dhabi-based investment manager Iceberg Capital Ltd on Wednesday launched a $1 billion crypto venture fund and said it was leading a $20 million funding round in virtual world platform Nümi Metaverse.

title: Ex-Coinbase manager's brother sentenced to 10 months in insider trading case
subheadlines: The brother of a former Coinbase Global Inc product manager was sentenced on Tuesday to 10 months in prison after pleading guilty in what U.S. prosecutors have called the first insider trading case involving cryptocurrency.

title: Cryptoverse: Bitcoin digs in for a bumpy new year
subheadlines: Bitcoin's looking steady in 2023. But it's only been a week.

title: Britain to push ahead with readying ground for a digital pound
subheadlines: Getting the design of a digital pound right is a bigger priority than a rapid launch, Britain's Financial Services Minister Andrew Griffith said on Tuesday.

title: Justices weigh scope of attorney-client privilege in crypto tax probe
subheadlines: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday wrestled with to what extent attorney-client privilege shields lawyers' communications with their clients from disclosure when the documents contain more than just legal advice and address other matters.

title: Analysis: Bankman-Fried fraud charges sidestep debate over how U.S. law sees crypto
subheadlines: Sam Bankman-Fried may find it hard to argue the fraud charges against him should be tossed because of uncertainty as to how U.S. law treats cryptocurrency, as other high-profile defendants in criminal cases involving digital assets have done.

title: Who is Alex Mashinsky, the man behind the alleged Celsius crypto fraud?
subheadlines: Alex Mashinsky, a co-founder of bankrupt crypto lender Celsius Network who prosecutors allege bilked investors out of billions, is a serial entrepreneur who has portrayed himself as a modern-day Robin Hood.

title: Factbox: From BlockFi to Genesis, crypto firms reel from exposure to FTX
subheadlines: After the collapse of major cryptocurrency exchange FTX, the industry has felt a ripple effect due to the exposure of many companies to FTX and its affiliated trading firm Alameda Research. FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried on Jan. 3 pleaded not guilty to criminal charges that he cheated investors and caused billions of dollars in losses.

title: Crypto bank run vindicates watchdogs’ vigilance
subheadlines: Alan Lane’s dreams may have collapsed, but his bank has not. Silvergate Capital , a deposit-taker for cryptocurrency firms, said on Thursday that it had been forced to raise funds in a hurry and flog assets after digital-asset customers pulled almost 70% of their balances. It’s a disaster for Lane and his investors. For the U.S. banking system and households who rely on it, there is much to reassure.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried pleads not guilty in FTX fraud case; October trial set
subheadlines: A judge set an Oct. 2 trial date.

title: Bankman-Fried set to enter not guilty plea in FTX fraud case
subheadlines: Sam Bankman-Fried is expected on Tuesday to enter a plea of not guilty to criminal charges that he cheated investors and looted billions of dollars at his now-bankrupt FTX cryptocurrency exchange, according to a source familiar with the matter.

title: U.S. dollar down, still set for best year since 2015
subheadlines: The dollar was on track to post its best year since 2015 on Friday in the last trading day of a year dominated by Federal Reserve rate hikes and fears of a sharp slowdown in global growth.

title: How 2022 shocked, rocked and rolled global markets
subheadlines: Trillions of dollars wiped off world stocks, bond market tantrums, whip-sawing currency and commodities and the collapse of a few crypto empires - 2022 has been perhaps the most turbulent year investors have ever seen, and for good reason.

title: Solana crypto token loses most of its value in 2022, FTX collapse weighs
subheadlines: The price of Solana, a cryptocurrency token that had been lauded by FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried, fell 10.36% on Wednesday, and is down 94.2% so far in 2022.

title: UK's Argo Blockchain shares soar on deals to avoid bankruptcy
subheadlines: Crypto miner Argo Blockchain said on Wednesday it will sell its mining facility Helios for $65 million and refinance a new asset-backed loan as it seeks to avoid bankruptcy, sending its London-listed shares soaring.

title: Crypto exchange Kraken to stop operations in Japan
subheadlines: U.S.-based crypto exchange Kraken said on Wednesday it would cease its operations in Japan next month, citing the current market conditions in the country and a weak crypto market globally.

title: U.S. probes how $370 million vanished in hack after FTX bankruptcy - Bloomberg News
subheadlines: Federal prosecutors are investigating an alleged cybercrime that drained more than $370 million from crypto exchange FTX hours after it filed for bankruptcy, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday citing a person familiar with the case.

title: Dollar flat as investors digest China's loosening of COVID rules
subheadlines: The dollar was flat on Tuesday after China said it would scrap its COVID-19 quarantine rule for inbound travelers - a major step in reopening its borders, even as COVID cases spike.

title: Bankman-Fried, FTX execs received billions in hidden loans, ex-Alameda CEO says
subheadlines: Sam Bankman-Fried and other FTX executives received billions of dollars in secret loans from the crypto mogul's Alameda Research, the hedge fund's former chief told a judge when she pleaded guilty to her role in the exchange's collapse.

title: FTX's Bankman-Fried, charged with 'epic' fraud, released on $250 million bond
subheadlines: The bail package would require Bankman-Fried to surrender his passport and remain in home confinement at his parents' home in Palo Alto, California. He would also be required to undergo regular mental health treatment and evaluation.

title: Bitcoin miner Core Scientific approved for $37.5 mln bankruptcy loan
subheadlines: U.S. bitcoin miner Core Scientific received court approval on Thursday to fund its Chapter 11 case with a $37.5 million loan from a group of existing creditors.

title: Dollar rises as U.S. data lends support
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar rose against most major peers on Thursday after U.S. data pointed to labor market strength that could keep the Federal Reserve hawkish for longer.

title: How 2022 shocked, rocked and rolled global markets
subheadlines: Trillions of dollars wiped off world stocks, bond market tantrums, whip-sawing currency and commodities and the collapse of a few crypto empires - 2022 has been perhaps the most turbulent year investors have ever seen, and for good reason.

title: El Salvador to receive $150 mln from development bank for education
subheadlines: El Salvador will receive a $150 million loan from Latin American development bank CAF to strengthen its education system, the lender said in a Wednesday statement.

title: Yen retreats after BOJ policy tweak sparked surge
subheadlines: The yen fell in a choppy session on Wednesday, ceding some of the ground gained the previous day when a surprise policy tweak by the Bank of Japan lifted the Japanese currency by 4% against the dollar.

title: Core Scientific files for bankruptcy as crypto winter bites
subheadlines: Core Scientific Inc , one of the biggest publicly traded cryptocurrency mining companies in the United States, said on Wednesday it filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, the latest in a string of failures to hit the sector.

title: FTX's Bankman-Fried signs extradition papers as Wednesday hearing looms
subheadlines: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried has signed legal papers paving the way for his extradition from The Bahamas to the United States, where he faces fraud charges over the cryptocurrency exchange's collapse, a Bahamas official said on Tuesday.

title: Cryptocurrencies at crossroads after annus horribilis
subheadlines: To borrow from Britain's Queen Elizabeth, 2022 is not a year on which the cryptocurrency world shall look back with undiluted pleasure.

title: Chinese electric automaker Nio hit by data breach
subheadlines: China-based Nio Inc said on Tuesday that hackers had breached its computer systems and accessed data on users and vehicle sales, in the latest hacking incident to hit the global auto industry.

title: Yen surges after surprise BOJ policy tweak
subheadlines: The yen jumped to a four-month high against the U.S. dollar, on pace for its biggest one-day rise in 24 years, on Tuesday after the Bank of Japan stunned markets with a surprise tweak to its bond yield control program.

title: Cryptoverse: Bye-bye to the year that broke bitcoin
subheadlines: Bitcoin staggered into 2022. It ends the year slumped in an alleyway, robbed of its cocktail of cheap money and leveraged bets, shunned by the establishment.

title: Central African Republic delays crypto token listing, cites 'market conditions'
subheadlines: The Central African Republic, which adopted bitcoin as legal tender in April, said on Monday it had delayed listing its national cryptocurrency token, citing "current market conditions" and "marketing reasons."

title: FTX's Bankman-Fried to agree to U.S. extradition in about-face after hearing -source
subheadlines: Sam Bankman-Fried has decided to agree to be extradited to the United States to face fraud charges, a person familiar with the matter said on Monday, just hours after the FTX founder's lawyer told a Bahamas judge he was not ready to consent.

title: Dollar slips vs euro on upbeat German business morale data
subheadlines: The dollar edged down against the euro as upbeat German business morale data supported the common currency, while a modest improvement in investors' appetite for riskier currencies weighed on the safe-haven dollar.

title: Special Report: Binance's books are a black box, filings show, as it tries to rally confidence
subheadlines: The world’s biggest crypto exchange has promised transparency. But filings show that the core of the business – the giant Binance.com exchange – remains mostly hidden from public view.

title: Insurers shun FTX-linked crypto firms as contagion risk mounts
subheadlines: Digital currency traders and exchanges are uninsured for any losses from hacks, theft or lawsuits.

title: Crypto exchange Bitvavo says it aims to recoup 280 million euros from DCG
subheadlines: Dutch cryptocurrency exchange Bitvavo said on Saturday it is trying to recover 280 million euros ($296.30 million) from U.S.-based Digital Currency Group (DCG) and its subsidiaries.

title: Auditing firm Mazars pauses work for crypto clients
subheadlines: French auditing firm Mazars said on Friday it has paused all work for clients in the crypto business, reflecting a broader sentiment in the global high-finance industry as companies distance themselves from the beleaguered sector.

title: CSOP bitcoin futures ETF closes higher in Hong Kong debut
subheadlines: Hong Kong's first bitcoin and ether futures exchange traded funds (ETFs) ended their first trading day higher on Friday, reflecting investors' interest despite the broader crypto market meltdown.

title: EVs and crypto mining seen as emerging risks for U.S. power reliability
subheadlines: The adoption of electric vehicles and rise of cryptocurrency mining pose emerging challenges to U.S. power reliability in upcoming years, the North American Electric Reliability Corporation said on Thursday.

title: Amid crypto turmoil, Hong Kong debuts first crypto futures ETFs
subheadlines: Two exchange traded funds (ETF) that track U.S.-listed cryptocurrency futures have raised a combined $73.6 million ahead of their debut on the Hong Kong stock exchange on Friday in defiance of the sector's meltdown.

title: Factbox: Major cryptocurrency cases probed by U.S. authorities
subheadlines: Charges brought by U.S. prosecutors against Sam Bankman-Fried, the founder of cryptocurrency exchange FTX, on Tuesday were among the highest-profile brought against a crypto player. It was the latest in a string of cases involving digital assets that U.S. regulators and prosecutors have been looking into.

title: Wall Street sees past Fed's lower rate hike to finish in red
subheadlines: Wall Street stocks dropped on Wednesday, while Treasury yields were flat and the dollar volatile, after the U.S. Federal Reserve announced that it would raise interest rates by half a percentage point but projected additional increases by the end of 2023, a rise in unemployment and a near stalling of economic growth.

title: FTX founder Bankman-Fried in custody after fraud charges, bail denied
subheadlines: A Bahamian judge denied FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried bail on Tuesday, hours after U.S. prosecutors accused the 30-year-old of misappropriating billions of dollars and violating campaign laws in what has been described as one of America's biggest financial frauds.

title: Explainer: Sam Bankman-Fried: Who is FTX's founder and why was he arrested?
subheadlines: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried was arrested in the Bahamas on Monday and charged by the U.S. Department of Justice on Tuesday with defrauding investors in what regulators called a "brazen, multi-year scheme" that ended when his empire filed for bankruptcy last month.

title: Wall St cautiously optimistic as easing inflation lifts hopes of smaller rate hike
subheadlines: Wall Street stocks gained on Tuesday, while Treasury yields fell and the dollar weakened, as new U.S. government data showed the smallest annual increase in inflation in nearly a year.

title: Binance withdrawals hit $1.9 bln in 24 hours, data firm says
subheadlines: Binance has registered $1.9 billion of withdrawals in the past 24 hours, blockchain data firm Nansen said on Tuesday, as the world's biggest crypto exchange said it had "temporarily paused" withdrawals of the USDC stablecoin.

title: Factbox: From BlockFi to Genesis, crypto firms reel from exposure to FTX
subheadlines: After the collapse of major cryptocurrency exchange FTX, the industry is bracing for further pain because of the exposure of many companies to FTX and its affiliated trading firm Alameda Research.

title: Cryptoverse: Jump or slump? $30k or $5k? Play the bitcoin roulette
subheadlines: Plucky bitcoin's been holding steady since seeing off the chaos of the FTX collapse, gathering its strength to rally towards the dizzy heights of $30,000 in 2023.

title: Former FTX CEO Bankman-Fried arrested in Bahamas after U.S. files charges
subheadlines: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried was arrested in the Bahamas at the behest of U.S. prosecutors on Monday, the day before he was due to testify before Congress about the abrupt failure last month of one of the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchanges.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried's sudden turn from white knight to detainee
subheadlines: The sudden fall from grace and arrest of FTX's former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried has stunned investors and crypto enthusiasts who once hailed the 30-year-old American as the savior of the industry.

title: Gold is better portfolio diversifier than bitcoin -Goldman Sachs
subheadlines: Goldman Sachs expects gold, with its real demand drivers, to outperform the highly volatile bitcoin in the long term, the bank wrote in a Monday research note.

title: Crypto winter end in sight as Ethereum looks to shake the chills- analysts
subheadlines: Most big banks and investment managers expect the cryptocurrency market to pick up in 2023 after a brutal year that saw bitcoin sink around 75% from its all-time high in November last year.

title: Dollar edges up against euro after U.S. inflation data
subheadlines: The dollar edged higher against the euro on Friday after U.S. producer inflation data for November came in slightly hotter than expected, bolstering the case for continued interest rate hikes by the Federal Reserve even if at a slower pace.

title: U.S. court weighs novel issue of crypto ownership in bankruptcy
subheadlines: A U.S. judge this week is considering for the first time the question of who owns bitcoin and other tokens in frozen accounts at a bankrupt digital asset exchange in a case that could shape customer protections in the cryptocurrency industry.

title: Dollar falls against major currencies amid economy concerns; yuan strengthens
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar weakened against major currencies on Wednesday amid concerns that rising interest rates could push the U.S. economy into recession, while a loosening of China's COVID restrictions boosted the yuan.

title: ECB seeks urgent regulation after multiple crypto bubbles burst
subheadlines: Crypto assets are here to stay so their regulation is urgently needed to protect investors and the stability of the global financial landscape, European Central Bank board member Fabio Panetta said on Wednesday.

title: Column: 2023 market predictions - when the outrageous and plausible blur
subheadlines: As some banks publish their semi-serious market predictions for the year ahead, the utterly wild ride that blindsided everyone in 2022 suggests that, this time around, they should perhaps indeed be taken semi-seriously.

title: Cryptoverse: Forget crypto winter, this is a bitcoin 'bloodbath'
subheadlines: "I'm nearly bankrupt," says Jad Fawaz, a crypto trader in Abu Dhabi. "I'm laughing because there's no point in exerting more depression and more frustration about it."

title: U.S. agency investigating crypto firms for misconduct
subheadlines: A U.S. agency that probes allegations of deceptive conduct confirmed on Monday that it had investigations open into several cryptocurrency firms for "possible misconduct."

title: Fintech Circle terminates $9 bln deal with Bob Diamond-backed SPAC
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency operator Circle Internet Financial said on Monday it has decided to end a $9 billion deal with blank-check firm Concord Acquisition Corp , nearly ten months after an earlier agreement was amended.

title: Crypto meltdown a boon for bankruptcy lawyers
subheadlines: Turmoil in the cryptocurrency industry has rattled major exchanges and sent the value of digital assets tumbling, but at least one group stands to gain: bankruptcy lawyers.

title: After FTX collapse, pressure builds for tougher crypto rules
subheadlines: Regulators must step in to protect crypto investors after the collapse of FTX, financial industry executives and lawmakers said at the Reuters NEXT conference this week, the latest call for tougher oversight of a sector prone to meltdowns.

title: Flummoxed Congress dims faith in post-FTX fixes
subheadlines: A congressional grilling on cryptocurrency answered a lot of questions, but far more about the ignorance on Capitol Hill than digital currencies. The U.S. Senate Agriculture Committee on Thursday held the first public hearing since Sam Bankman-Fried’s FTX collapsed last month, kicking off Washington’s broader effort to beef up regulation of the industry. It hardly inspired confidence about the ability of lawmakers to protect investors.

title: Factbox: Crypto companies crash into bankruptcy
subheadlines: 2022 has been a rough year for the crypto industry. The price of bitcoin has dropped 65% since the start of the year, the cryptocurrency Luna suffered a total collapse in value, and crypto exchange FTX went from buying Super Bowl ads to crash landing into bankruptcy.

title: LSEG CEO says weak links in markets exposed by recent volatility
subheadlines: London Stock Exchange Group Plc Chief Executive David Schwimmer said on Thursday that large spikes in volume associated with algorithmic trading have worsened recent market volatility, exposing weak links in the global market infrastructure.

title: Kraken to cut about 1,100 global jobs as crypto winter bites
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency exchange Kraken said on Wednesday it would cut its global workforce by 30%, or about 1,100 employees, citing tough market conditions that have crippled demand for digital assets this year.

title: ECB says Bitcoin is artificially propped up, shouldn't be legitimised
subheadlines: Bitcoin is being artificially propped up and should not be legitimised by regulators or financial companies as it is more akin to gambling, the European Central Bank said on Wednesday.

title: FTX collapse shows urgent need to finalise EU crypto rules, says European Commission
subheadlines: The "questionable practices" at now collapsed crypto exchange FTX would not have been allowed to happen under European Union rules that need to be finalised urgently, a senior European Commission official said on Wednesday.

title: No spot Bitcoin ETFs approved so far - U.S. SEC official
subheadlines: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has yet to approve any spot bitcoin exchange-traded fund listings to date, commissioner Mark Uyeda said at the sidelines of a forum in Singapore on Wednesday.

title: Binance enters Japanese market with Sakura Exchange BitCoin deal
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency exchange operator Binance said on Wednesday it acquired Sakura Exchange BitCoin (SEBC), a crypto exchange service registered in Japan, to expand into the Asian country.

title: Cryptoverse: Messi takes on Ronaldo in fan coin world cup
subheadlines: The market for fan tokens, a volatile cocktail of crypto and sport, is heating up in the desert of Qatar.

title: Special Report: Trolls, propaganda and fear stoke Bukele's media machine in El Salvador
subheadlines: A Salvadoran twenty-something had been looking for work when an unexpected invitation arrived to sit down with a government official.

title: Crypto lender BlockFi files for bankruptcy, cites FTX exposure
subheadlines: It is the latest industry casualty after being hurt by exposure to the spectacular collapse of the FTX exchange.

title: Dollar rebounds on Fed expectations, Aussie drops
subheadlines: The dollar clawed back earlier losses on Monday as a hawkish Federal Reserve official laid out the case for further rate hikes, while the Australian dollar sank on concerns about unrest over COVID-19 restrictions in China.

title: 3 Crypto lender BlockFi files for Chapter 11
subheadlines: U.S. cryptocurrency lender BlockFi said on Monday it had filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection along with eight affiliates in a New Jersey court, the latest casualty since FTX's collapse earlier this month triggered instability in the crypto market.

title: Take Five: Everything to play for
subheadlines: The final month of the year is almost here but there's no time yet to slow down, with latest U.S. jobs numbers and euro zone inflation data coming up.

title: Binance CEO Zhao says don't fight crypto, regulate it
subheadlines: Binance Chief Executive Officer Changpeng Zhao said on Friday regulation rather than opposition of the crypto sector is a better option for world governments as digital currencies become more mainstream.

title: Dollar edges up in range-bound holiday markets
subheadlines: The dollar edged higher across the board on Friday in a quiet session following the U.S. Thanksgiving holiday but remained near multi-month lows as the prospect of the Federal Reserve moderating the pace of its policy tightening weighed on the U.S. currency.

title: Breakingviews: Crypto winter highlights gold’s warming qualities
subheadlines: The crypto winter is bitterly cold. The frost set in earlier this year with the collapse of Terra, a digital token supposedly pegged to the U.S. dollar. The recent failure of Sam Bankman-Fried’s FTX exchange has further lowered the temperature. The aggregate market capitalisation of cryptocurrencies has shrunk by more than $2 trillion, a fall of some 70% from the peak, according to CoinMarketCap.com. As institutional investors run for the hills, financial regulators are closing in. The inevitable question arises: do cryptocurrencies have a future? To which the answer is: not under anything resembling normal circumstances.

title: No place for flowers: El Salvador's biggest lake swamped by trash
subheadlines: A horse wades through a sea of plastic bottles, tin cans and green sludge that fills El Salvador's largest freshwater lake, stark images showing how a key drinking water source goes neglected even as global environmental concerns are on the rise.

title: Global regulators to target crypto platforms after FTX crash
subheadlines: The crash of FTX exchange has injected greater urgency into regulating the crypto sector and targeting such 'conglomerate' platforms will be the focus for 2023, the new chair of global securities watchdog IOSCO said in an interview.

title: Special Report: Crypto exchanges enabled online child sex-abuse profiteer
subheadlines: In the eight years he ran an online market selling images of violent child sexual abuse, Michael Mohammad made the equivalent of more than 100,000 euros. At his trial in May, while some of his victims listened, he told the judge: "It was purely business."

title: Dollar down as Fed minutes, U.S. data weighs
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar fell across the board on Wednesday, after minutes from the Federal Reserve's November meeting showed that most policymakers at the central bank agreed it would soon be appropriate to slow the pace of interest rate hikes.

title: El Salvador govt seeks Congress approval to issue bitcoin-backed bonds
subheadlines: The government of El Salvador, the first country in the world to adopt bitcoin as legal tender, is seeking congressional approval to issue investment bonds in the cryptocurrency.

title: FTX was run as 'personal fiefdom,' faces hacks, missing assets, attorneys say
subheadlines: FTX was run as a "personal fiefdom" of former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried, attorneys for the collapsed crypto exchange said in its first bankruptcy hearing as they detailed ongoing challenges such as hacks and substantial missing assets.

title: Hong Kong’s crypto push sets up race to bottom
subheadlines: Few cities in the world have expressed a desire to throw open cryptocurrency trading to retail investors since the devastating collapse of Sam Bankman-Fried’s exchange. That puts Hong Kong in a league of its own.

title: Cryptoverse: Let's talk about DEX, baby
subheadlines: As the crypto castle crumbles, some true believers say the answer is to double down on DEX. Decentralized exchanges, that is.

title: Dollar slips as investors tiptoe back into riskier currencies
subheadlines: The dollar retreated across the board on Tuesday, ceding some of the ground gained in the previous session, as investors looked past worries about China's COVID flare-ups, boosting demand for more risky currencies.

title: Morning Bid: Wild oil ride amid China and crypto woe
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan.

title: U.S. Senate to hold FTX hearing on Dec. 1, CFTC chairman to testify
subheadlines: The U.S. Senate Agriculture Committee on Thursday said it will hold a hearing on Dec. 1 to examine the sudden collapse of FTX, one of the world's biggest crypto exchanges.

title: Dollar rises as China COVID worries spook markets
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar rose against most major currencies on Monday, recouping recent losses, as fresh COVID-19 curbs in China fuelled worries over the global economic outlook and made traders shun riskier currencies.

title: Investors flock to short crypto funds, products as negative sentiment deepens  -CoinShares
subheadlines: Institutional investors rushed to crypto products that bet on price declines, posting record inflows, as the collapse of digital asset exchange FTX rippled across the industry and significantly weighed on market sentiment, according to weekly data from digital asset manager CoinShares released on Monday.

title: COVID in China sets sterling for biggest daily fall in two weeks
subheadlines: Sterling slipped against a strengthening U.S. dollar on Monday as global risk sentiment was dented by rising COVID-19 cases in China, which led to new restrictions in the world's second largest economy.

title: Morning Bid: Bucking the trend
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan.

title: Column: Good money after bad? Crypto still seems to be attracting punters
subheadlines: If a series of high-profile multibillion-dollar blow-ups, alleged fraud and a 75% collapse in the price of your biggest asset doesn't shake faith in the crypto universe, it's hard to imagine what will.

title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire warns about crypto website using its name
subheadlines: Berkshire Hathaway Inc , run by billionaire Warren Buffett, on Friday warned investors it has no affiliation with a purported cryptocurrency brokerage website using the Berkshire Hathaway name.

title: U.S. dollar positioning turns net short for first time since July 2021 -CFTC, Reuters data
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar's net positioning turned net short in the latest week for the first time since mid-July 2021, according to calculations by Reuters and U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission data released on Friday.

title: Global stocks gain on hopes recession warning forces Fed's hand
subheadlines: Global equities edged up and a key part of the Treasury yield curve inverted further on Friday, a sign the U.S. economy will stall next year and that investors hope will lead the Federal Reserve to back off its aggressive hiking of interest rates.

title: EXCLUSIVE How FTX bought its way to become the 'most regulated' crypto exchange
subheadlines: Documents reveal the strategy and tactics behind founder Sam Bankman-Fried's regulatory agenda, including previously unreported terms of a deal announced earlier this year with IEX Group.

title: Hong Kong's leading crypto retail operator says it ceases trading as FTX fallout roils sector
subheadlines: A leading cryptocurrency retail service provider in Hong Kong said it has ceased trading as the broader fallout from the collapse of FTX, and solvency issues at other major crypto firms, continues to roil the sector.

title: Dollar gains, stocks slip as Fed officials talk tough on rates
subheadlines: The dollar rose and equity markets slid on Thursday after hawkish remarks from Federal Reserve officials reminded investors a less aggressive monetary policy is unlikely with U.S. employment data still showing a tight labor market.

title: Tumbling bitcoin overshadows El Salvador's crypto conference
subheadlines: El Salvador's long-awaited bitcoin conference, which was in the limelight in 2021 after the small nation became the world's first to adopt the cryptocurrency as legal tender, has lost its luster this time amid a deep rout in the digital currency universe.

title: Brazil crypto law back on agenda as FTX collapse sends shockwaves
subheadlines: Brazilian crypto advocates are urging lawmakers to give final approval on a bill aimed at boosting oversight of the sector, after the collapse of FTX - once an industry darling - raised fresh concern about unregulated digital currencies.

title: Musk says he made some Tesla decisions without board nod, defends $56 bln pay
subheadlines: Elon Musk said in court on Wednesday that he made some Tesla Inc decisions without the approval of the company's directors, as he defended his $56 billion pay package against claims that he dictated its terms to a compliant board.

title: Crypto watchdogs have a giant offshore problem
subheadlines: Tighter cryptocurrency regulation is inevitable after the collapse of exchange FTX. Even so, there will still be places that the rules don’t touch. Big players like Binance, as well as services based on so-called decentralised finance, may stay out of reach. That ensures the edgier aspects of crypto will live on.

title: Global stocks slip, dollar steady as retail sales tip Fed outlook
subheadlines: Global stocks slid from two-month highs and the safe-haven dollar steadied on Wednesday after stronger-than-expected U.S. retail sales clouded the inflation outlook and hopes that the Federal Reserve could ease its aggressive interest rate hikes.

title: FTX fallout hits crypto lender Genesis; Bankman-Fried, celebs sued
subheadlines: Major crypto player Genesis Global Capital suspended customer redemptions in its lending business on Wednesday, citing the sudden failure of crypto exchange FTX, while court papers showed FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried faces legal action.

title: U.S. House committee to hold hearing on collapse of FTX
subheadlines: The U.S. House Financial Services Committee said on Wednesday it plans to hold a hearing in December to investigate the collapse of cryptocurrency exchange FTX.

title: Grayscale Bitcoin Trust falls as cryptocurrencies slide again
subheadlines: Grayscale Bitcoin Trust , the world's largest bitcoin fund, fell almost 7% on Wednesday, as investors dumped more digital assets after last week's high-profile unraveling of crypto exchange FTX.

title: Special Report: FTX's Bankman-Fried begged for a rescue even as he revealed huge holes in firm's books
subheadlines: As customers withdrew billions of dollars from crypto exchange FTX one frantic Sunday this month, founder Sam Bankman-Fried worked the phones in a futile bid to raise $7 billion in emergency funds.

title: Cryptoverse: So long, Solana? Ether rival clobbered by FTX crash
subheadlines: Solana, a poster coin of the crypto future, is in trouble.

title: FTX creditors may number over 1 million as regulators seek answers
subheadlines: Collapsed crypto exchange FTX outlined a "severe liquidity crisis" in U.S. bankruptcy filings, which said the group could have more than 1 million creditors, as regulators opened probes and the crypto pain spread with the Wall Street Journal reporting BlockFi was planning layoffs and a possible bankruptcy filing.

title: Global stocks rise but Polish deaths raise market concerns
subheadlines: Stocks rose and the dollar fell on Tuesday after data provided new signs U.S. inflation was peaking, but markets were rattled by media reports that said Russian missiles killed two people in Poland, news that raised fears of an escalation in the Ukraine war.

title: U.S. SEC delays decision on ARK 21Shares spot bitcoin ETF to Jan. 27
subheadlines: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Tuesday delayed a decision on whether to allow a spot bitcoin exchange-traded fund by stock-picker Cathie Wood's Ark Invest and crypto investment product firm 21Shares US to list and trade on Cboe Global Markets until Jan. 27.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried did financial system a favour
subheadlines: Sam Bankman-Fried has tipped the cryptocurrency industry into crisis. But the spectacular implosion of FTX, the exchange he founded, has done the broader financial system a big favour. The curly-haired kingpin was at the forefront of pushing regulators and politicians to legitimise digital assets like bitcoin. His downfall will slow that process – and may even send it into reverse.

title: Stocks end down, U.S. yields up as investors assess Fed path
subheadlines: A gauge of global stocks ended lower on Monday in choppy trade and U.S. bond yields rose as investors assessed comments from Federal Reserve officials to try and determine the central bank's path of rate hikes.

title: Regulators circle FTX as rival exchanges try to calm investors
subheadlines: Regulators opened probes following last week's spectacular collapse of crypto exchange FTX and rival exchanges sought to reassure jittery investors of their own stability, weighing on cryptocurrencies on Monday.

title: U.S. dollar gains ground as investors focus on future Fed path
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar gained against the yen and the euro on Monday but pulled back from its highs of the day with investors betting on a slower pace of Federal Reserve interest rate hikes going forward.

title: Linklaters hires energy finance partner from Sidley Austin in New York
subheadlines: UK-founded law firm Linklaters on Monday said it has hired a finance-focused partner from Sidley Austin in New York to head its energy and infrastructure practice in the Americas.

title: Fed's Brainard: Crypto finance needs strong regulation
subheadlines: Recent turmoil in the cryptocurrency market shows the need for it to be firmly regulated the same way traditional finance is, Federal Reserve Vice Chair Lael Brainard said on Monday.

title: Morning Bid: Reality check
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan.

title: Take Five: A UK budget and trouble in crypto land
subheadlines: The long-awaited UK fiscal plan is (almost) here and after the ructions unleashed by September's mini-budget, markets are paying close attention.

title: FTX collapse being scrutinized by Bahamas authorities
subheadlines: FTX filed for bankruptcy after traders rushed to withdraw $6 billion over 72 hours.

title: FTX hit by rogue transactions, analysts saw over $600 million outflows
subheadlines: The collapsed crypto firm was engulfed in further chaos when it said it detected unauthorized transactions.

title: Further details emerge on FTX bankruptcy and missing funds
subheadlines: Further details on the bankruptcy of crypto exchange FTX emerged on Saturday, even as peers and partners distanced themselves from the firm and sources told Reuters at least a billion dollars of customer funds on the exchange had vanished.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried's sudden turn from white knight to washout
subheadlines: Sam Bankman-Fried earned a reputation as savior of the crypto industry when he bailed out two platforms earlier this year. But when FTX, the exchange he co-founded and led until Friday, needed a lifeline, none was forthcoming.

title: Crypto markets in turmoil over FTX bankruptcy
subheadlines: Crypto exchange FTX filed for U.S. bankruptcy on Friday and Sam Bankman-Fried stepped down as CEO, after a liquidity crisis that has prompted intervention from regulators around the world.

title: Stocks rally as Fed rate hopes dent dollar
subheadlines: Global stocks rallied on Friday for a second day on hopes cooler U.S. inflation would lead to less aggressive interest rate hikes by the Federal Reserve, an outlook that pushed the dollar to its biggest two-day drop in 13 years.

title: Crypto exchange FTX files for bankruptcy as wunderkind CEO exits
subheadlines: Crypto exchange FTX filed for U.S. bankruptcy protection on Friday and its founder Sam Bankman-Fried resigned as chief executive, after the biggest blowup in the crypto industry drew calls for tighter regulation.

title: Dollar extends fall after inflation data knock
subheadlines: The dollar fell across the board for a second straight day on Friday, as investors favoured riskier currencies following signs U.S. inflation is cooling that boosted the case for the Federal Reserve to ease off its hefty interest rate hikes.

title: Analysis: FTX meltdown sparks investor rethink of battered crypto market
subheadlines: A week of turmoil culminating in major crypto exchange FTX filing for bankruptcy has left investors questioning the viability of a sector already bruised by the bitcoin bubble bursting and closures of key market players.

title: Crypto stocks slide as FTX prepares for bankruptcy proceedings
subheadlines: Shares of cryptocurrency and blockchain-related firms dropped on Friday after FTX, one of the biggest crypto exchanges, said it would initiate bankruptcy proceedings in the United States, triggering a potentially massive meltdown in the industry.

title: FTX to start U.S. bankruptcy proceedings, CEO to exit
subheadlines: Crypto exchange FTX is to start U.S. bankruptcy proceedings and chief executive Sam Bankman-Fried is to step down, after a liquidity crisis at the cryptocurrency group that has prompted intervention from regulators around the world.

title: Investors gobble up bonds as worst of inflation may be over -BofA
subheadlines: Investors bought more bonds than at any time in the last four months in the week to Wednesday as signs emerged that inflation may have peaked, BofA Global Research said on Friday.

title: Morning Bid: Disinflation stations
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan.

title: FTX looks for $9.4 bln in rescue funds, Bahamas freezes some assets
subheadlines: FTX is scrambling to raise about $9.4 billion from investors and rivals, a source said on Thursday, as Chief Executive Sam Bankman-Fried urgently seeks to save the cryptocurrency exchange that has been buffeted by a rush of customer withdrawals.

title: Exclusive: Behind FTX's fall, battling billionaires and a failed bid to save crypto
subheadlines: On Tuesday morning, Sam Bankman-Fried, owner of cryptocurrency exchange FTX, caught his employees off-guard with a somber message.

title: Dollar slides, CPI data suggests Fed could slow pace of rate hikes
subheadlines: The dollar fell sharply on Thursday after U.S. consumer prices rose less than expected in October to suggest underlying inflation is cooling, data that Wall Street cheered as it may allow the Federal Reserve to get less aggressive with interest rate hikes.

title: Wall St ends sharply higher as cooling inflation fuels hope of easing Fed
subheadlines: U.S. stocks jumped, the dollar tanked and Treasury yields tumbled on Thursday as cooler-than-expected inflation data suggested the Federal Reserve's barrage of interest rate hikes are beginning to have their intended effect.

title: Morning Bid: Cooling, and melting down
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in Asian markets from Lewis Krauskopf

title: Trading in crypto derivatives surges as investors hedge positions after FTX shock
subheadlines: Trading volumes in bitcoin futures and exchange traded funds (ETFs) has exploded as investors scrambled to hedge their positions after this week's slump in digital tokens triggered by turmoil at crypto exchange FTX.

title: CoinShares says has $30.3 million exposure to FTX
subheadlines: Crypto asset manager CoinShares has $30.3 million worth of exposure to crypto exchange FTX, CoinShares said in a statement on Thursday.

title: Morning Bid: Consumer inflation, crypto deflation
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan.

title: Crypto's FTX CEO looking at all options as Binance deal collapses
subheadlines: Sam Bankman-Fried told employees Binance had not previously expressed reservations about the deal.

title: Breakingviews: FTX crash is old lesson for financial newcomers
subheadlines: FTX is a young company facing an ancient financial problem. Sam Bankman-Fried’s cryptocurrency exchange is hanging in the balance, after customers wanted their money back and it wasn’t able to oblige. Potential saviour and rival Binance walked away from a rescue bid on Wednesday. While it may be of little consolation to Bankman-Fried, the industry could end up better off for FTX’s agonies.

title: World stocks slip, await CPI, U.S. midterms outcome
subheadlines: U.S. stocks fell sharply and the dollar rose on Wednesday as investors awaited both the results of the U.S. midterm elections and key data on consumer prices that could impact the Federal Reserve's policy on interest rates.

title: Morning Bid: CPI catches the eye, crypto crumbles
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in Asian markets from Jamie McGeever.

title: Dollar higher as investors look past U.S. midterms to inflation data
subheadlines: The dollar advanced against most major currencies on Wednesday, as results so far for the U.S. midterm elections showed little evidence of a "red wave" resounding Republican victory that some expected, leaving investors to focus on upcoming inflation data.

title: Galaxy Digital to cut majority exposure to crypto exchange FTX
subheadlines: Crypto financial services company Galaxy Digital Holdings Ltd said on Wednesday it was looking to cut nearly 62% of its exposure to FTX, after fears of instability at the embattled crypto exchange sparked fears of a contagion.

title: Cryptocurrencies fall after FTX-Binance turmoil spooks investors
subheadlines: Cryptocurrencies saw a second day of sharp declines on Wednesday, as investors continued to fret about the stability of the sector and the financial health of major exchange FTX despite plans for a rescue deal from bigger rival Binance.

title: Cryptoverse-Elon Musk frees the bird and the dog coin flies
subheadlines: It's no joke. Elon Musk's acquisition of Twitter has put fresh wind in the sails of dogecoin, the meme cryptocurrency he catapulted to fame.

title: Morning Bid: Congress unswept, crypto a mess
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan.

title: Morning Bid: Bank man fried
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook

title: Binance plans to buy rival FTX in bailout as crypto market crumbles
subheadlines: Crypto giant Binance signed a nonbinding agreement on Tuesday to buy FTX's non-U.S. unit to help cover a "liquidity crunch" at the rival exchange, in a stunning bailout that raised fresh concerns among investors about cryptocurrencies.

title: Wall Street ends higher, Treasury yields dip as election day rolls on
subheadlines: U.S. stocks gyrated to a higher close on Tuesday, and Treasury yields edged lower as Americans went to the polls and market participants bided their time waiting to see whether Capitol Hill is in for a power shift.

title: Dollar slips as German bund yields strengthen euro
subheadlines: The dollar slid on Tuesday as rising German bond yields strengthened the euro, but a strong reading of the consumer price index later this week could reverse the currency's slide.

title: Stocks rally, dollar slips as sentiment favors risk assets
subheadlines: Equity markets rose and the dollar slid on Monday as investors embraced the idea that China may ease COVID restrictions and burnished hopes the U.S. economy is slowing enough to allow the Federal Reserve to ease its aggressive hiking of interest rates.

title: Euro, sterling bounce, dollar drops as investors cash in
subheadlines: Euro and sterling rose against the safe-haven dollar on Monday, supported by a risk-on sentiment across markets as investors digested positive euro zone data and looked to cash in on the strength of the U.S. currency.

title: U.S. lays claim to $1 billion in stolen Silk Road Bitcoin
subheadlines: The United States is seeking the forfeiture of more than $1 billion in Bitcoin stolen from the Silk Road online marketplace, federal prosecutors in Manhattan said on Monday.

title: FTX's founder dismisses balance sheet concerns as 'false rumors'
subheadlines: Sam Bankman-Fried, the billionaire founder of crypto exchange FTX, sought to reassure crypto investors on Monday after a rival exchange, Binance, said it would liquidate its holdings of FTX's native token.

title: Crypto exchange Binance helped Iranian firms trade $8 billion despite sanctions
subheadlines: Crypto giant Binance has processed Iranian transactions with a value of $8 billion since 2018 despite U.S. sanctions intended to cut Iran off from the global financial system, blockchain data show.

title: Lisbon tech schmooze takes baby steps to reality
subheadlines: Tech bubbles are bursting everywhere. Web Summit, the sector’s annual bash held in Lisbon, is doing the opposite. Volumes of newly mask-free attendees to the event co-founded by Paddy Cosgrave in Dublin a decade ago have returned to their pre-pandemic levels of over 70,000, compared to some 40,000 last year.

title: Coinbase reports third-quarter loss as volumes drop
subheadlines: U.S. cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase Global Inc on Thursday reported a third-quarter loss as high inflation, rising interest rates and geopolitical tensions weakened demand for risky assets, sapping trading volumes for digital currencies like bitcoin.

title: WNBA star Griner visited in Russian jail by U.S. officials for first time in months
subheadlines: Officials from the U.S. Embassy in Moscow met with Brittney Griner on Thursday, officials said, in the first visit in months for the WNBA star who is jailed in Russia and could soon be transferred to a penal colony.

title: Dorsey's Block posts a jump in revenue, boosting shares
subheadlines: Block Inc posted a rise in third-quarter revenue on Thursday as the growth of Cash App helped make up for stagnant cryptocurrency prices that had dogged the payments platform led by Twitter founder Jack Dorsey in previous quarters.

title: France, Singapore, Switzerland jointly test central bank digital currencies
subheadlines: France, Singapore and Switzerland have launched a joint trial of their experimental central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) in the first cross-regional trial of its kind.

title: Robinhood, Coinbase find sanctuary in interest income amid market rout
subheadlines: For U.S. online trading companies an often-overlooked financial metric could act as a bulwark against softening demand in the third quarter, according to analysts.

title: Cryptoverse: Bitcoin wants to break its bond with stocks
subheadlines: After months of tears and tantrums, bitcoin wants to split up with stock markets.

title: Grocery retailer Pick n Pay to start accepting cryptocurrency payments
subheadlines: One of South Africa's largest grocery retailers Pick n Pay is expanding a pilot of adding cryptocurrency as a payment option to more stores after the successful completion of the first phase, it said on Tuesday.

title: Apollo holds crypto for clients as it expands in digital assets
subheadlines: Apollo Global Management Inc has begun holding cryptocurrency on behalf of its clients through a partnership with digital asset platform Anchorage Digital, in a major push by one of the world’s largest asset managers to bring crypto to institutional investors.

title: Blockchain firm Valereum gets approval to buy Gibraltar exchange
subheadlines: Blockchain company Valereum said on Monday it has received regulatory approval to buy the Gibraltar Stock Exchange (GSX) and turn it into a gateway to European capital for fledgling companies from the Middle East, India and Africa.

title: Dogecoin surges on Elon Musk's Twitter deal
subheadlines: Dogecoin surged more than 70% on Saturday, extending this week's gains after Elon Musk sealed a $44-billion deal to  last week.

title: Crypto exchange Binance, Musk's co-investor, to help Twitter with blockchain
subheadlines: Binance, the world's largest crypto exchange that has invested $500 million into Elon Musk's buyout of Twitter Inc, is creating a team to work on how blockchain and crypto could be helpful to Twitter, the company's spokesperson said on Friday.

title: Dollar sells off on speculation of less hawkish Fed, euro regains parity
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar sank more than 1% against a basket of peers on Wednesday as weakening economic data firmed views that the Federal Reserve will slow the pace of its rate hiking cycle, sending the euro back above parity with the greenback for the first time in a month.

title: Exchange operator CME tops profit views as trading volumes surge
subheadlines: Futures exchange operator CME Group Inc reported third-quarter profits that beat expectations as volatility in the global markets amid high inflation, aggressive rate hikes and recession fears, drove trading volumes higher.

title: Crypto industry disappointed as Australia looks to enshrine tax rules
subheadlines: The cryptocurrency industry said on Wednesday it was disappointed with Australia's decision to continue treating digital currencies as assets for tax purposes, and not as foreign currency.

title: Cryptoverse: British pound fiasco boosts bitcoin's hedge appeal
subheadlines: As a developed nation, you know your currency's in a spot of bother when investors start to hedge with bitcoin.

title: U.S. charges two Chinese nationals with obstructing Huawei case, source says
subheadlines: U.S. prosecutors said on Monday they have charged two Chinese nationals with trying to obstruct prosecution of a Chinese telecommunications company that a person familiar with the matter identified as Huawei Technologies Co Ltd (HWT.UL).

title: U.S. sues crypto 'mixer' to recover $60 million government penalty
subheadlines: The U.S. Justice Department on Wednesday sued the indicted founder of a cryptocurrency "mixer" to recover a $60 million civil penalty that was imposed on him in 2020 by U.S. financial regulators for alleged failures to maintain an effective anti-money laundering program.

title: German online bank N26 to launch crypto trading in Austria
subheadlines: German online bank N26 said on Thursday it would begin allowing some customers in Austria to trade cryptocurrencies, in its first foray into the asset class.

title: Brazil's Nubank to introduce cryptocurrency as part of rewards program
subheadlines: Brazil's Nubank on Wednesday announced plans to release its own cryptocurrency as part of a new customer rewards program.

title: Crypto law firm Roche Freedman parts ways with founder after video leak
subheadlines: Kyle Roche has separated from the New York-based law firm he co-founded, Roche Freedman, following allegations that he abused investor lawsuits to aid a client, blockchain company Ava Labs Inc.

title: Former Celsius exec joins JPMorgan as director of crypto regulatory policy
subheadlines: Former Celsius executive Aaron Iovine has joined JPMorgan Chase & Co as executive director of digital assets regulatory policy, according to his LinkedIn profile, days after the bank's Chief Executive Jamie Dimon blasted cryptocurrencies as fraud and decentralized ponzi schemes.

title: Crypto lender Voyager settles with executives who approved risky loan
subheadlines: Crypto lender Voyager Digital has agreed to settle claims against company executives who approved a risky nearly $1 billion loan to failed crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital (3AC) after minimal due diligence, a misstep that contributed to Voyager's own bankruptcy.

title: Cryptoverse: Flurry of funds bet on bruised bitcoin's allure
subheadlines: A growing number of funds are betting on the long-term appeal of bitcoin and ether, a gritty gambit in the depths of a crypto winter.

title: Dollar higher but gains in check as risk appetite rebounds
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar edged higher against a basket of currencies on Tuesday, shaking off some of the weakness of the previous session, but a revival in risk appetite in global financial markets kept a lid on its gains.

title: Bitcoin firm NYDIG lays off about a third of employees - WSJ
subheadlines: Bitcoin company NYDIG laid off about a third of its workforce last month to cut costs, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

title: Get out the Red Bull, 24/7 stock trading is coming, market execs say
subheadlines: Around-the-clock trading, a feature of cryptocurrency markets, is likely coming to U.S. equities within five years, some retail brokerages and exchange operators, including Robinhood Markets and Cboe Global Markets , said on Thursday.

title: Arizona cryonics facility preserves bodies to revive later
subheadlines: Time and death are "on pause" for some people in Scottsdale, Arizona.

title: Crypto firm 21Shares lists bitcoin ETP on Nasdaq Dubai
subheadlines: Crypto investment products firm 21.co said on Wednesday its subsidiary 21Shares AG has listed a bitcoin exchange-traded product on Nasdaq Dubai, making it the Middle East's first physically-backed bitcoin ETP.

title: Crypto's Grayscale blasts SEC over ‘special harshness’ toward bitcoin trading
subheadlines: Crypto asset manager Grayscale Investments LLC, which manages the world’s largest bitcoin investment fund, told a federal appeals court on Tuesday that the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is so suspicious of bitcoin spot trading that it blocked a proposal to make it easier and safer for investors to gain exposure to the cryptocurrency.

title: Grayscale says U.S. SEC set bar too high for Bitcoin funds
subheadlines: Grayscale Investments said in a court filing Tuesday that the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission set the bar too high for spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds, which have so far not been approved for listing on U.S. exchanges.

title: Britain cannot 'sit out' digital pound indefinitely, says City minister
subheadlines: Britain's financial services minister said on Tuesday that a lengthy delay in issuing a digital pound would create problems for finance and the economy.

title: Cryptoverse: Hack jitters push bitcoin investors back to the future
subheadlines: It's not easy being a crypto investor.

title: Jury finds former Uber security chief guilty of concealing data breach
subheadlines: The case pertains to a breach at Uber's systems that affected data of 57 million passengers and drivers. The company did not disclose the incident for a year.

title: SWIFT sets out blueprint for central bank digital currency network
subheadlines: Financial messaging system SWIFT has laid out its blueprint for a global central bank digital currency (CBDC) network following an 8-month experiment on different technologies and currencies.

title: Celsius co-founder and strategy head Leon resigns from bankrupt crypto lender
subheadlines: Celsius Network's co-founder and chief strategy officer Daniel Leon has stepped down, the bankrupt crypto lender said on Tuesday, joining a wave of executive departures from beleaguered digital asset companies.

title: Bridgewater's Dalio steps back, but his philosophy persists
subheadlines: Ray Dalio is known as much for his unique philosophy as for his investment performance. While his decision to relinquish control of Bridgewater, the world's largest hedge fund, marks a major transition for the storied firm, his influence will continue.

title: Cryptoverse: Trading names in a mind-boggling crypto craze
subheadlines: A new NFT trading craze where names are bought and sold for eye-popping sums is providing a multi-million-dollar lifeline for speculators shivering in the bleak crypto winter.

title: Kim Kardashian makes an example out of the SEC
subheadlines: Gary Gensler is gaining some Instagram fame. The U.S. Securities and Exchange chair imposed a $1.3 million penalty on Kim Kardashian in a transparent attempt to send a high-profile warning to other influencers and wannabes about the dangers of hyping cryptocurrency. In the end, though, she may wind up making an example out of him.

title: NFT sales plunge in Q3, down by 60% from Q2
subheadlines: Sales of non-fungible tokens dropped sharply in the third quarter, according to blockchain tracker DappRadar, as crypto investors hunker down for a "crypto winter" and demand for the highly speculative digital assets shows little sign of returning.

title: Bitcoin-sterling volumes spike to record high as British currency flounders
subheadlines: Trading volumes between the British pound and the cryptocurrency bitcoin spiked to a record high after sterling dropped on Monday, according to market data firm Kaiko Research, in what analysts said was likely a rush by investors to dump their sterling for the digital asset or profit from arbitrage.

title: Robinhood partners with USD Coin issuer to bring first stablecoin
subheadlines: Robinhood Markets Inc said on Wednesday it has joined forces with crypto firm Circle to provide customers the option to buy and sell stablecoin USD Coin (USDC) on the brokerage's platform.

title: Wall Street keeps selling as world assets fail to recover
subheadlines: U.S. stocks gave up early gains to fall deeper into a bear market on Tuesday, while sterling showed scant movement a day after hitting a record low, as investors remained nervous about a potential global recession.

title: Dollar takes a breather even as rate worries dent risk appetites
subheadlines: The dollar made little progress in a choppy session on Tuesday while appetites for riskier bets were still weak as Federal Reserve policymakers talked about more interest rate hikes.

title: Cryptoverse: Bitcoin miners get stuck in a bear pit
subheadlines: Spare a thought for the beleaguered bitcoin miner.

title: Crypto regulation laggards spur arbitrage risk - French central banker
subheadlines: Countries that are slow to build up regulations for crypto assets could create arbitrage risks that players operating globally could exploit, the head of France's central bank said on Tuesday.

title: Crypto exchange FTX to acquire bankrupt Voyager's assets
subheadlines: Voyager Digital said on Monday crypto exchange FTX, whose bailout proposal the bankrupt lender had rejected earlier this year, has won its assets in a $1.42-billion bid at an auction.

title: Bitcoin mining struggles to go green, research shows
subheadlines: Bitcoin is struggling to go green, with the cryptocurrency making only slim gains in its usage of sustainable energy in the year to January, research by Cambridge university showed on Tuesday.

title: Bitcoin bounces above $20,000 for first time in about a week
subheadlines: Bitcoin broke above $20,000 on Tuesday for the first time in about a week, as cryptocurrencies bounced, along with other risk-sensitive assets, in Asian trade.

title: Russia plans to use digital rouble in settlements with China, says lawmaker
subheadlines: After launching a digital rouble early next year, Russia plans to use the currency in mutual settlements with China as it seeks to reduce Washington's global financial hegemony, a senior Russian lawmaker said on Monday.

title: Stocks tumble, dollar soars and bonds plunge as recession fears grow
subheadlines: U.S. and European stocks tumbled on Friday, the dollar scaled a 22-year high and bonds sold off again as fears grew that a central bank prescription of raising interest rates to tame inflation will drag major economies into recession.

title: Crypto exchange Kraken has no U.S. SEC registration plans, says incoming CEO
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency exchange Kraken has no plans to delist tokens the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has labeled as securities, or to register with the agency as a market intermediary, said incoming chief executive officer Dave Ripley on Thursday.

title: What crisis? High-stakes crypto lending looks here to stay
subheadlines: On May 11, Scott Odell, an analyst at British crypto lender Blockchain.com, instant messaged Edward Zhao of Three Arrows Capital asking that the Singapore hedge fund repay at least part of a $270 million loan.

title: Yen spikes after Japan intervention, stocks slump
subheadlines: The yen spiked higher on Thursday after the Federal Reserve's strong stance on rates the day before roiled the outlook for bonds and stocks while forcing Japan to intervene in FX markets to support its currency for the first time since 1998.

title: Stocks gyrate, dollar gains as Fed keeps hawkish stance
subheadlines: U.S. stocks rose, then slumped while Treasury yields surged and then fell on Wednesday as markets reacted wildly to a bleak economic picture next year after the Federal Reserve adhered to a tough stance to fight inflation by jacking up interest rates.

title: Nasdaq bets big on digital assets despite crypto turmoil
subheadlines: Nasdaq Inc is placing a big bet on the cryptocurrency market, with the launch of a digital assets business that is aimed at tapping institutional investors.

title: Cryptoverse: After Merge, ether heads for a $20 billion Shanghai splurge
subheadlines: The Merge came, saw and conquered. Not that you'd guess from crypto prices.

title: Crypto law firm Roche Freedman fights to stay in bitcoin case after videos surface
subheadlines: A hotly contested disqualification fight at the 11th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals should provide a good indication of just how much damage the crypto law firm Roche Freedman is facing after last month’s revelation of surreptitious video recordings of name partner Kyle Roche.

title: Treasury yields jump before Fed meeting, dollar gains
subheadlines: The benchmark 10-year Treasury yield hit its highest in over a decade on Monday and the dollar strengthened as investors were on edge before an expected hefty Fed interest rate hike this week to tackle inflation.

title: FOREX U.S. dollar sails higher as markets price in hefty Fed rate hike
subheadlines: The dollar rose against major currencies on Monday, trading within narrow ranges, ahead of a slew of central bank meetings this week led by the Federal Reserve, which is likely to raise interest rates by another 75 basis points (bps).

title: Bitcoin falls below $19,000 as cryptos creak under rate hike risk
subheadlines: Cryptocurrencies fell to fresh lows on Monday on regulatory concerns and as investors globally turned shy on risky assets with interest rate rises looming around the world.

title: Morning Bid: Hunkering down for a new phase in the inflation fight
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Dhara Ranasinghe.

title: Bitcoin once again slips below $20,000
subheadlines: Bitcoin on Sunday dropped 1.54% to $19,804, slipping from the 20,000 mark after losing $310 from its previous close.

title: S&P says it could downgrade El Salvador in 6-18 months
subheadlines: S&P Global Ratings said on Friday it could cut El Salvador's already negative credit rating within six to 18 months if it does not make "adequate progress" on debt reduction, days after the government announced plans to buy back sovereign bonds.

title: Dollar edges down but posts gains for week; yuan slips past key level
subheadlines: The dollar index was down slightly on Friday but registered a gain for the week as investors expected the U.S. Federal Reserve to remain aggressive when it hikes interest rates next week, while China's yuan eased past the key threshold of 7 per dollar.

title: U.S. SEC's crypto guidelines push up costs for lenders, disrupting projects
subheadlines: Banks' cryptocurrency projects have been upended by U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) accounting guidance that would make it too capital-intensive for lenders to hold crypto tokens on behalf of clients, according to more than half a dozen people with knowledge of the matter.

title: 'The selling pressure is feeding on itself:' ARK, meme stocks tumble as Fed hike looms
subheadlines: Sizzling inflation that helped send 2-year U.S. Treasury yields to fresh 14-year highs continued to burn some of the winners of the so-called pandemic bubble Friday.

title: Despite prohibition, El Salvador President Bukele says he will seek re-election
subheadlines: El Salvador President Nayib Bukele said Thursday he would run for re-election, despite the country's constitution prohibiting presidents from having consecutive terms.

title: Galaxy Digital sued for $100 mln for ditching landmark Bitgo deal
subheadlines: Galaxy Digital Holdings Ltd , a crypto financial services firm, should pay at least $100 million in damages for walking away from its $1.2 billion takeover deal for BitGo Inc, the digital asset custodian said in a court filing made public on Thursday.

title: Dollar inches up vs yen as investors expect Fed will stay aggressive
subheadlines: The dollar was slightly higher against the yen on Thursday following data showing U.S. retail sales unexpectedly rebounded in August, while the Swiss franc hit its strongest against the euro since 2015.

title: Ethereum blockchain slashes energy use with 'Merge' software upgrade
subheadlines: The Ethereum blockchain has undergone a major software upgrade, drastically reducing its energy usage, its inventor and co-founder tweeted on Thursday.

title: Big Divides
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan.

title: Explainer: Ethereum's energy-saving Merge upgrade
subheadlines: Ethereum, the blockchain that underpins the world's second-largest crypto token ether, on Thursday underwent a major software upgrade that slashes the amount of energy needed to create new coins and carry out transactions.

title: U.S. charges three Iranians for ransomware attacks on women's shelter, businesses
