subheadlines: Three Iranians have been charged with trying to extort hundreds of thousands of dollars from organizations in the United States, Europe, Iran and Israel, including a domestic violence shelter, by hacking in to their computer systems, U.S. officials said on Wednesday.

title: Dollar index has biggest daily pct gain since 2020 after unexpected rise U.S. consumer prices
subheadlines: The dollar rallied against the yen, euro and other currencies on Tuesday after stronger-than-expected U.S. inflation data boosted investor bets that the Federal Reserve will need to stay aggressive in raising interest rates.

title: Cryptoverse: Ether snaps at bitcoin's heels in race for crypto crown
subheadlines: For years, ether could barely dream of challenging its big brother bitcoin. Now, its ambitions may be becoming more realistic.

title: Canada PM Trudeau attacks new Conservative leader as 'reckless'
subheadlines: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Monday attacked veteran lawmaker Pierre Poilievre, who was elected new leader of the opposing Conservative Party, for what Trudeau called "reckless" economic policies.

title: Dollar eases back from recent gains as focus on U.S. inflation data; euro jumps
subheadlines: The dollar fell to its lowest level in more than two weeks against a basket of currencies on Monday following recent strong gains, as investors grew nervous ahead of U.S. inflation data and as central banks outside of the United States appeared increasingly hawkish.

title: Ethereum blockchain to undergo major upgrade to cut energy use
subheadlines: A long-awaited software upgrade to the Ethereum blockchain aimed at slashing its huge energy consumption is expected this week, a move proponents say may widen the technology's use and support the price of the ether token.

title: Canada's Conservatives pick populist in bid to oust Trudeau's Liberals
subheadlines: Pierre Poilievre defeated his main competitor Jean Charest, a former Quebec premier, and three others in a campaign that blasted Trudeau and the central bank governor.

title: Stocks jump as growth shares lead; 2-year U.S. yields hit 14-year highs
subheadlines: Global stocks rallied on Friday, led by technology and growth shares, and interest-rate sensitive two-year U.S. Treasury yields hit more than 14-year highs as investors digested the view that more interest rate hikes are needed.

title: Bankrupt crypto lender Celsius agrees to examiner review
subheadlines: Crypto lender Celsius Network has agreed to the U.S. Department of Justice's demand for an independent examiner to review its finances and operations in bankruptcy, after reaching a deal that limited the proposed scope of the investigation.

title: Dollar slides as investors balance positions ahead of U.S. inflation data
subheadlines: The dollar fell to a more than one-week low on Friday as investors consolidated gains after a sharp rise against most currencies, ahead of a U.S. inflation report that could determine the size of the Federal Reserve's rate hike at this month's policy meeting.

title: FTX Ventures plans to take 30% stake in Scaramucci's SkyBridge Capital
subheadlines: FTX Ventures plans to scoop up a 30% stake in SkyBridge Capital, the companies said, making it the latest in a flurry of deals by cryptocurrency's white knight Sam Bankman-Fried.

title: Bitcoin leaps above $21,000 as U.S. dollar sags
subheadlines: Bitcoin surged past the $20,000 barrier and was potentially heading for its best day in six months on Friday as the U.S. dollar fell broadly and markets found reasons to be cheerful at the end of a dour week.

title: Explainer: Understanding Ethereum's major 'Merge' upgrade
subheadlines: Ethereum, the blockchain that underpins the world's second-largest crypto token ether, will soon undergo a major software upgrade that promises to slash the amount of energy needed to create new coins and carry out transactions.

title: Analysis: Rebounding real yields spell trouble for U.S. stocks
subheadlines: Expectations of more jumbo rate hikes from the Federal Reserve are pushing up real yields in the United States, putting pressure on everything from technology shares and meme stocks to bitcoin.

title: A year on, El Salvador's bitcoin experiment is stumbling
subheadlines: A year after El Salvador adopted bitcoin as legal tender, the area where the world's first cryptocurrency city was meant to be built - a circular metropolis powered by a volcano - is still dense jungle.

title: State securities regulators seek more transparency in Celsius crypto bankruptcy
subheadlines: State securities regulators from Texas, Vermont and Wisconsin on Wednesday pushed for greater transparency in the bankruptcy of cryptocurrency lender Celsius Network LLC, joining the U.S. Department of Justice's call for a court-appointed examiner to ensure that Celsius is providing creditors with accurate information.

title: Resilient U.S. dollar soars to 24-year high vs yen, 37-year peak vs sterling
subheadlines: The dollar surged to a 24-year peak against the yen and a 37-year high versus sterling on Wednesday, as Japan's dovish monetary policy and Europe's economic problems contrasted with a relatively stronger U.S. economy and a hawkish Federal Reserve determined to bring down inflation to its 2% inflation target.

title: Yen freefall
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan.

title: Cryptoverse: Bitcoin's no longer the king of the swingers
subheadlines: Bitcoin's been called a lot of things. Buzzy, beguiling, baffling, even bogus. But never boring.

title: Lawyer of alleged crypto launderer urges Russia to discuss prisoner swap - letter
subheadlines: The lawyer of a Russian man accused of laundering more than $4 billion through the digital currency bitcoin urged Moscow on Monday to begin negotiations with the United States to include his client in a potential prisoner swap.

title: Dollar hits 20-year high as data support aggressive Fed
subheadlines: The dollar index vaulted to a 20-year high on Thursday, and notched a 24-year peak against the rate-sensitive Japanese yen, after U.S. data showed a resilient economy, giving the Federal Reserve more room to aggressively hike interest rates to quell inflation.

title: Crypto fans still live in a supervised world
subheadlines: Since the dawn of history, the person with the bigger stick could easily take the person with the smaller stick’s money. That, at least, is one of many philosophies espoused by MicroStrategy founder Michael Saylor. He is beyond enthusiastic about the ability of bitcoin to change the planet, thanks to its “freedom and self-sovereignty”, and he has bet his company's future on it. Unfortunately he still lives in a supervised world.

title: Canada's Conservatives set to embrace populist to take on Trudeau
subheadlines: Canada's Conservatives next month look set to embrace a career politician who has promised to fire the central bank governor and promoted bitcoin as an inflation hedge to become its fourth leader since 2020.

title: Stocks struggle, oil down, on rate and recession fears
subheadlines: World stocks fell again on Wednesday, as expectations that central banks on both sides of the Atlantic will likely raise borrowing costs again next month soured sentiment and stoked recession fears, which dragged oil prices below $90 a barrel.

title: Dollar eases, but remains near 2-decade highs
subheadlines: The dollar eased against a basket of currencies on Wednesday, but remained near the 2-decade high hit on Monday, as traders braced for more interest rate hikes from the U.S. Federal Reserve.

title: Dollar edges higher as oversized Fed rate hike bets rise
subheadlines: The dollar edged higher on Tuesday, but was below the 20-year high it hit a day earlier, while the euro broke back above parity, as markets priced in super-sized interest rate hikes by the U.S. Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank (ECB).

title: Cryptoverse: Bleeding bitcoin's holding out for a hero
subheadlines: Who can save bitcoin?

title: Dollar eases off of 20-year high as euro boosted by rates view
subheadlines: The dollar touched a fresh 20-year high on Monday, lifted by hawkish comments by Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, but was kept in check as the euro was boosted by growing expectations for European Central Bank (ECB) rate hikes.

title: Central African Republic top court blocks purchases with new cryptocurrency
subheadlines: Central African Republic's Constitutional Court on Monday ruled that the purchase of citizenship, "e-residency" and land using a cryptocurrency the government launched last month was unconstitutional.

title: Morning Bid: Powell steals summer punchbowl
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan.

title: Bitcoin dips below $20,000
subheadlines: Bitcoin dipped below $20,000 on Saturday, continuing a drop that has taken it down nearly 60% from its year high.

title: Asset managers to offer fund tokens despite crypto turmoil
subheadlines: Investors in crypto have endured wild moves in recent months, but this has not fazed asset managers who are preparing to use the blockchain technology behind cryptocurrencies to break funds into bite-sized units, or tokens, to sell to small savers.

title: Jack Dorsey's Block ends Afterpay smartphone tie-up with Australia's Westpac
subheadlines: Afterpay, the Australian payments firm bought by Jack Dorsey's Block Inc , and Australia's Westpac Banking Corp ended a partnership after the firm cancelled a smartphone app it was running with the bank, the companies said.

title: Cboe says Robinhood and Virtu among potential equity partners in crypto exchange
subheadlines: Cboe Global Markets Inc on Thursday said it is in discussions with several market participants, including retail brokers and market makers, about taking strategic stakes in its recently acquired digital asset exchange, ErisX, which will be renamed Cboe Digital.

title: Bitcoin Depot to list in the U.S. through $885 mln SPAC deal
subheadlines: Fintech Bitcoin Depot plans to list in the United States by merging with blank check company GSR II Meteora Acquisition Corp in a deal valued at $885 million, the companies said on Thursday.

title: Wire fraud: the most powerful law in crypto right now
subheadlines: Ian McGinley of Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP discusses the Department of Justice's use of the wire fraud statute to bring cases in the cryptocurrency space and what to expect going forward.

title: Shares slip, dollar firms on recession concerns
subheadlines: U.S. shares fell sharply and the dollar surged on Monday as fears mounted that central bank efforts to tame rising consumer prices with inflation-busting interest-rate hikes will weaken the global economy and lead to a recession.

title: Dollar rises on risk aversion; euro revisits parity
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar rose across the board on Monday, driving the euro back below parity, as investors shied away from riskier assets amid growing fears that interest-rate hikes in the United States and Europe, aimed at curbing inflation, would weaken the global economy.

title: U.S. dollar net longs rise; euro shorts hit biggest since February 2020
subheadlines: Speculators' net long positioning on the U.S. dollar rose in the latest week, while net shorts on the euro increased, according to calculations by Reuters and U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission data released on Friday.

title: Wall Street pushes stocks down, dollar up on Fed hike fears
subheadlines: U.S. stocks fell and the dollar rose on Friday, even as Treasury yields gained, with traders anxious about inflation and what the Federal Reserve will do to combat it.

title: Crypto trader can sue IRS over ‘John Doe’ summons for Coinbase records, court says
subheadlines: The U.S. Internal Revenue Service risks losing a blunt weapon in its years-long campaign to collect income taxes from cryptocurrency investors after a ruling from the 1st U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals.

title: Dollar driven to five-week high by Fed rate hike forecasts
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar index hit a five-week high and posted its biggest weekly gain since April 2020 on Friday as investors adjusted for the likelihood that the Federal Reserve will keep hiking rates to battle inflation.

title: Sudden crypto drop sends bitcoin to three-week low
subheadlines: Cryptocurrencies fell sharply on Friday, with sudden selling dragging bitcoin to a three-week low, with analysts divided over the reason behind the decline.

title: D.C. turf war opens crypto regulatory arbitrage
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency ventures can divide and conquer Washington’s regulatory fiefdoms. The U.S. Federal Reserve staked out its turf this week, telling lenders to notify it if they offer services for bitcoin and its ilk. Other agencies are also wrestling to oversee the $1 trillion market. The scrap provides an opportunity for some industry participants, but it hurts token owners.

title: Valereum to end bitcoin mining to focus on Gibraltar exchange
subheadlines: Blockchain company Valereum said on Thursday it was selling its bitcoin mining assets to Vinanz Ltd for a 24% stake in the company as part of plans to acquire and expand the Gibraltar Stock Exchange.

title: ECB steps in as banks dip toes in crypto pool
subheadlines: The European Central Bank (ECB) said on Wednesday it would harmonise how banks offer cryptoassets to ensure they have enough capital and expertise in a sector some European Union lawmakers have described as the Wild West.

title: Crypto lender Celsius gets court sign-off to sell bitcoin, but not stocks or debt
subheadlines: Crypto lender Celsius Network LLC got signoff on Tuesday from a U.S. bankruptcy judge to mine and sell bitcoins during its bankruptcy.

title: Cryptoverse: Electric ether leaps on verge of Merge
subheadlines: It looks like ethereum's mega-upgrade is happening. Finally.

title: Losses from crypto hacks surged 60% to $1.9 billion from January to July, Chainalysis says
subheadlines: Losses arising from cryptocurrency hacks jumped nearly 60% in the first seven months of the year to $1.9 billion, propelled by a surge in funds stolen from decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols, according to a blog post from blockchain analysis firm Chainalysis released on Tuesday.

title: Aussie, kiwi sink as China's recovery falters; yuan eases on surprise rate cut
subheadlines: The Australian and New Zealand dollars retreated from near two-month highs on Monday after a new batch of dissappointing data from China, a key trading partner, while the yuan weakened following a surprise rate cut.

title: Aussie, kiwi fall as China's recovery falters; yuan eases on surprise PBOC rate cut
subheadlines: The risk-sensitive Australian and New Zealand dollars retreated from near two-month highs against the greenback on Monday due to dissappointing data from China, a key trading partner, while the Chinese yuan weakened after a surprise cut in interest rates.

title: Abrdn buys stake in digital assets exchange Archax
subheadlines: British asset manager abrdn has bought a stake in digital assets exchange Archax, amid a wider push by investors into crypto-assets despite a recent plunge in value.

title: Crypto derivatives volumes surge to $3.12 trillion in July - CryptoCompare
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency derivatives trading on centralised exchanges rose to $3.12 trillion in July, a 13% monthly increase, researcher CryptoCompare said on Thursday, as crypto prices show signs of recovery from the recent market crash.

title: BlackRock launches spot bitcoin private trust for U.S. clients
subheadlines: BlackRock Inc , the world's biggest asset manager, has launched a spot bitcoin private trust for institutional clients in the United States, according to a blog post on its website.

title: DOJ demands more insight into Celsius' severance payments, bitcoin sales
subheadlines: The U.S. Department of Justice has demanded more court oversight of Celsius Networks' plans to make employee severance payments and to sell bitcoins during the cryptocurrency lender's bankruptcy.

title: Morning Bid: Fed doesn't see enough swallows for summer
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in markets from Alun John

title: Australian crypto ownership warrants consumer protection, says regulator
subheadlines: Nearly half of Australian retail investors owned cryptocurrency in late 2021 and more got their information from YouTube videos than from financial advisers, the securities watchdog said on Thursday, calling the data a "strong case for regulation".

title: Binance says it is winning crypto clients thanks to inflation
subheadlines: Binance, the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, is seeing a surge in clients due to rising inflation and a historically strong dollar that has depressed emerging market currencies, an executive told Reuters on Wednesday, without disclosing numbers.

title: Dollar drops on cooler-than-expected U.S. inflation data
subheadlines: The dollar fell broadly on Wednesday following a cooler-than-expected U.S. inflation report for July that raised expectations of a less aggressive interest rate hike cycle than previously anticipated from the Federal Reserve.

title: Ripple Labs interested in bankrupt crypto lender Celsius' assets
subheadlines: San Francisco-based blockchain payments company Ripple Labs Inc, which is embroiled in a high-profile battle with the U.S. securities regulator, is interested in potentially purchasing assets of bankrupt crypto lender Celsius Network, according to a company spokesperson.

title: Coinbase posts loss as crypto market turmoil hits trading volumes
subheadlines: Coinbase Global Inc reported a larger-than-expected quarterly loss as investors worried by this year's rout in risky assets shied away from trading in cryptocurrencies, sending its shares down 6% after the bell on Tuesday.

title: Iran makes first import order using cryptocurrency - report
subheadlines: Iran made its first official import order using cryptocurrency this week, the semi-official Tasnim agency reported on Tuesday, a move that could enable the Islamic Republic to circumvent U.S. sanctions that have crippled the economy.

title: New guilty plea in BitMEX crypto exchange laundering case
subheadlines: The first employee of BitMEX pleaded guilty on Monday to violating U.S. bank secrecy laws by failing to establish an anti-money laundering program, following guilty pleas to the same charge by the cryptocurrency exchange's three co-founders.

title: Wall Street muted on mixed inflation messages
subheadlines: Wall Street stocks were mostly flat on Monday, the dollar weakened and U.S. government bond yields fell as investors weighed mixed messages on inflation and how aggressive the Federal Reserve might be in combating it.

title: Crypto platform Zipmex to start releasing Bitcoin, Ether for customers
subheadlines: Crypto exchange Zipmex will release Ethereum and Bitcoin tokens from this week, a spokesperson said on Monday, allowing 60% of its customers to retrieve their digital assets after a suspension of withdrawals from its Z Wallet product.

title: Dorsey's Block slows hiring, investment after reporting Q2 loss
subheadlines: Jack Dorsey-led Block Inc said it has slowed hiring and will slash its 2022 investment target by $250 million, after a slump in bitcoin prices dragged the digital payments company to a loss in the second quarter.

title: U.S. dollar posts broad gains after unexpectedly strong jobs data
subheadlines: The dollar rallied across the board on Friday, notching its biggest daily percentage gain since mid-June against the yen, after a stronger-than-expected U.S. payrolls report suggested the Federal Reserve may need to continue aggressively raising interest rates in the near term.

title: Block shares slip after crypto winter dampens quarterly results
subheadlines: Shares of Jack Dorsey-led Block Inc , a digital payments firm that has bet big on bitcoin, declined nearly 7% in premarket trading on Friday after the company reported a loss in quarterly results on waning interest in cryptocurrencies.

title: Thai central bank to test retail digital currency late this year
subheadlines: Thailand's central bank said on Friday it expected to test its retail digital currency from late this year to the middle of 2023, as an alternative payment option.

title: Oil drops with dollar on recession fears; Wall Street ends mixed
subheadlines: Crude oil sank with Treasury yields and the dollar on Thursday as recession worries intensified following the Bank of England's warning of a drawn-out downturn and ahead of key a hotly anticipated U.S. employment report on Friday.

title: It’s not so bad being a bubble stock after all
subheadlines: At $310 billion AMTD Digital is worth roughly 10 Twitters , almost four Targets , one-and-a-half Walt Disneys , or three-quarters of a Meta Platforms . The Hong Kong-based digital-platform company, created by local financial-services firm AMTD Idea , is the latest firm whose shares have been fueled by irrationally exuberant investors – be it the meme-stock craze that swept up businesses from GameStop to AMC Entertainment , or other bubble-like market mentalities that gave massive boosts to Robinhood Markets , Microstrategy and the like. Sure, the air has come out of most of the hype – but it was still worth it.

title: Crypto winter may temper fintech earnings
subheadlines: Wall Street has lowered earnings expectations for once high-flying fintechs Coinbase and Block , as a chill in the cryptocurrency market adds more pain to the companies already grappling with surging costs and rapidly rising rates.

title: Senate bill would hand bitcoin, ether oversight to commodities regulator
subheadlines: A new bill introduced in the U.S. Senate would make the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) the direct regulator of the biggest cryptocurrencies.

title: Honduras launches 'Bitcoin Valley' in the tourist town of Santa Lucia
subheadlines: People can pay for a slushie with crypto in the streets of "Bitcoin Valley," a project in the Honduran tourist enclave of Santa Lucia through which the country has entered the digital currency trend.

title: EU securities watchdog to arm itself with crypto data
subheadlines: The European Union's securities watchdog has begun preparations for increased scrutiny of crypto transactions after the bloc agreed groundbreaking rules to regulate what it called a "Wild West" sector, a public tender document showed.

title: Fraud charges in hacking case against Uber ex-security chief are dismissed
subheadlines: A U.S. judge on Tuesday granted a request by prosecutors to dismiss fraud counts against a former Uber Technologies Inc security chief also charged with covering up a 2016 data hack affecting 57 million passengers and drivers.

title: Cryptoverse: Bitcoin beats the heat in a jumpin' July
subheadlines: It's been a good month for bitcoin - and we haven't said that for a while.

title: Bitcoin rises 3.4% to $24,584; up 39.7% from year low in June
subheadlines: Bitcoin rose 3.36% to $24,584.24 at 1707 GMT on Saturday, adding $798.93 to its previous close.

title: Exchange operator Cboe writes down bulk of ErisX acquisition
subheadlines: Cboe Global Markets Inc on Friday reported second-quarter profit slightly below Wall Street expectations as compensation costs rose, and also said it took a $460 million writedown on its recent purchase of digital asset exchange ErisX.

title: Top lawyer to exit Winkelvoss twins' crypto exchange Gemini
subheadlines: Gemini Trust Co's top lawyer, Sydney Schaub, is leaving the crypto exchange led by Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss to join Opendoor Technologies Inc, the online home-selling platform said on Thursday.

title: Factbox: The crypto crash hit these companies the hardest
subheadlines: Cryptocurrencies have been hard hit by fears interest rate hikes will end the era of cheap money, with the world’s largest digital asset, bitcoin, down more than 56% from this year’s high. Several crypto companies have filed for bankruptcy or have been forced to look for emergency capital infusions.

title: Crypto assets need new rights in law, UK legal body says
subheadlines: Britain should create a new category of private property law for digital assets like cryptocurrencies which are being used to make payments or represent other assets, independent body the Law Commission proposed on Thursday.

title: El Salvador says it has $560 mln for partial debt buyback
subheadlines: El Salvador will dedicate $560 million in funds to a surprise bond buyback plan, its finance minister said on Wednesday, as the impoverished country looks to ease worries about the state of its public finances.

title: Bitcoin rises 6.9% to $22,717
subheadlines: Bitcoin rose 6.85% to $22,717.05 at 22:05 GMT on Wednesday, adding $1,457.27 to its previous close.

title: Dollar falls after Fed hike, Powell comments
subheadlines: The dollar fell on Wednesday against a basket of major currencies after the U.S. Federal Reserve raised interest rates by 75 basis points, as was widely anticipated, and comments from Fed Chair Jerome Powell spurred hopes for a slower hiking path.

title: El Salvador to buy back some debt in surprise move
subheadlines: El Salvador's president announced on Tuesday a plan for a voluntary repurchase offer to holders of bonds maturing between 2023 and 2025.

title: Stocks fall, bonds rise as investors seek safety
subheadlines: Wall Street equities fell and U.S. Treasuries rallied on Tuesday a day before a likely Federal Reserve rate hike as investors grappled with growing economic concerns after retail giant Walmart Inc's profit warning and signs of a looming gas supply crisis in Europe.

title: Gas woes drag euro lower, dollar gains on recession worry
subheadlines: The dollar rose against a basket of major currencies on Tuesday, reversing course after three straight sessions of declines as recession fears grew and investors awaited a Federal Reserve policy statement, while energy supply concerns weighed on the euro.

title: Cryptoverse: What crisis? Venture capitalists bet big on crypto
subheadlines: It's not all doom and gloom.

title: Central African Republic's digital coin finds few buyers
subheadlines: The sale of Central African Republic's first digital coin got off to a slow start, with just over 5% of the target bought in the hours after its launch, amid questions about the project's transparency and a wider downturn in the industry.

title: Tesla raises spending plan, discloses new subpoena on Musk's 2018 tweet
subheadlines: Tesla Inc has increased its capital spending plan by $1 billion, the electric automaker said in a regulatory filing on Monday that also disclosed a second subpoena related to Chief Executive Elon Musk's go-private tweets in 2018.

title: Nasdaq falls with dollar, oil rises; earnings, Fed in focus
subheadlines: Nasdaq closed lower on Monday after a choppy session for U.S. equities ahead of a big week of technology earnings reports while oil prices rose and treasury yields edged higher as investors braced for a Federal Reserve interest rate hike.

title: Dollar falls for third straight session with Fed eyed
subheadlines: The dollar was lower against a basket of major currencies on Monday, as investors weighed the implications of a rate hike by the U.S. Federal Reserve in an economy that may be on the verge of a recession.

title: Mexican crypto exchange Bitso reaches more than 1 mln users in Brazil
subheadlines: Mexican cryptocurrency exchange Bitso has hit the one million users mark in Brazil about a year after it launched in the country, according to the company's Brazil chief.

title: Strong dollar: 10 reasons why it matters to you
subheadlines: The greenback is now at a 20-year high against other world currencies, thanks in part to expectations that the Federal Reserve will increase its interest rates faster than most.

title: Charitable deductions: donating cryptocurrency and NFTs for tax purposes
subheadlines: Eric N. Mann and Jacob H. Calvert of Neal Gerber Eisenberg explore issues relating to charitable contributions of NFTs and the requirements for securing charitable deductions.

title: Brazil's XP Inc to open crypto platform to clients in August
subheadlines: Brazilian brokerage XP Inc expects to open its digital assets trading platform to clients by mid-August, initially offering bitcoin and ether but with plans to expand it by the end of this year, the company's director of financial products said.

title: China vows privacy, information protection in using digital yuan
subheadlines: China will fully respect privacy and protect personal information in using the digital yuan, state media quoted a senior central bank official as saying on Sunday, as Beijing encourages greater adoption of e-CNY.

title: Uber admits covering up 2016 hacking, avoids prosecution in U.S. settlement
subheadlines: Uber Technologies Inc on Friday accepted responsibility for covering up a 2016 data breach that affected 57 million passengers and drivers, as part of a settlement with U.S. prosecutors to avoid criminal charges.

title: Dollar shrugs off dismal U.S. data to edge higher
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar shrugged off early weakness to edge higher against a basket of currencies on Friday, after data showed U.S. business activity shrank for the first time in nearly two years in July as a services slowdown outweighed manufacturing growth.

title: My Big Coin virtual currency firm founder convicted of fraud
subheadlines: The founder of a defunct cryptocurrency business was convicted on Thursday of charges that he defrauded investors and customers out of millions of dollars through lies and false claims that its virtual currency My Big Coin was backed by $300 million in gold.

title: Euro strengthens after ECB hikes faster than flagged
subheadlines: The euro rose against the U.S. dollar in a choppy session on Thursday, after the European Central Bank (ECB) delivered a 50 basis points rate hike to tame inflation in its first rate increase since 2011.

title: Brazil crypto exchange Mercado Bitcoin to expand into Mexico this year, says CEO
subheadlines: SoftBank-backed Brazilian crypto exchange Mercado Bitcoin is set to enter the Mexican market by the end of the year, as part of a plan to expand elsewhere in Latin America, its chief executive told Reuters.

title: Tesla profit tops target; Musk says high prices could hurt demand
subheadlines: Tesla on Wednesday reported a smaller-than-expected drop in quarterly profit, helped by a string of price increases for its cars, which Elon Musk later said were "embarrassingly high" and could hurt demand.

title: Bitcoin recovers after falling on news Tesla sold 75% of its holdings
subheadlines: Bitcoin rebounded after a brief sell-off late on Wednesday sparked by news that electric carmaker Tesla Inc had sold about 75% of its holdings of the virtual token.

title: Dollar rises vs euro as traders eye ECB rate decision
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar rose against the euro on Wednesday in a choppy session, but its gains were capped as traders were hesitant to drive big moves ahead of a crucial European Central Bank policy decision on Thursday.

title: Tesla braces for earnings hit, but EV delivery outlook is key
subheadlines: Tesla Inc's second-quarter results on Wednesday are expected to show the strains of China's COVID-19 lockdown and protracted startups of new factories. Investors want to know if the end of the year will be much better.

title: Bitcoin rises 5.11% to $23,564.93
subheadlines: Bitcoin rose 5.11% to $23,564.93 at 22:05 GMT on Tuesday, adding $1,145.77 to its previous close.

title: Cryptoverse: Holding your breath for a bitcoin bounce
subheadlines: If you're waiting for a bitcoin recovery, you may have to sweat it out for months. That's the conclusion of some technical specialists seeking method from the madness.

title: Texas bitcoin miners back online after power surge caused curtailments
subheadlines: Large-scale bitcoin mining operations in Texas are back online after sweltering temperatures that caused electricity use to spike led to power curtailments earlier in the month, an industry group said on Tuesday.

title: Dollar eases as ECB rate hike hopes boost euro
subheadlines: The dollar slipped against the euro for a third straight session on Tuesday, following a Reuters story that European Central Bank policymakers are considering raising interest rates by a bigger-than-expected 50 basis points at their meeting on Thursday to tame record-high inflation.

title: Crypto lender Celsius defends bitcoin mining plans as bankruptcy kicks off
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency lender Celsius Network said bitcoin mining is key to the company's restructuring efforts at a U.S. bankruptcy court hearing on Monday in Manhattan.

title: Dollar dips as rate hike bets ease
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar slipped to a one-week low against a basket of currencies on Monday, from the two-decade high hit last week, as traders pared bets on how aggressive the Federal Reserve would be in raising rates at its meeting later this month.

title: The big default? The dozen countries in the danger zone
subheadlines: Traditional debt crisis signs of crashing currencies, 1,000 basis point bond spreads and burned FX reserves point to a record number of developing nations now in trouble.

title: Central African Republic launches 'Sango Coin' cryptocurrency amid industry rout
subheadlines: Central African Republic will start selling a cryptocurrency it says will be worth $21 million next week, it said on Friday, amid a wider rout in the industry and scepticism over the project's feasibility in a poorly connected, war-torn country.

title: El Salvador finance minister says possible IMF deal no panacea
subheadlines: Salvadoran Finance Minister Alejandro Zelaya minimized on Thursday the potential positive impact of a long-delayed deal with the International Monetary Fund, even as the highly indebted country stares down a possible medium-term default.

title: Global crypto rules needed to keep markets clean, says UK watchdog
subheadlines: Global rules are needed to regulate international crypto firms like Binance and "keep markets clean", Britain's Financial Conduct Authority said on Thursday.

title: Texas grid takes emergency actions to avoid blackouts amid heatwave
subheadlines: Texas's power grid operator on Wednesday took emergency measures to avoid rolling blackouts as soaring electricity demand threatened to outpace available supplies amid a stifling heatwave.

title: Wall Street gulps as U.S. inflation tops 9%, euro pierces parity
subheadlines: World equities wavered on Wednesday as investors digested a report showing U.S. annual consumer prices jumped 9.1% in June -the largest increase in more than four decades - leaving Americans to dig deeper to pay for gasoline, food, healthcare and rent.

title: Euro back above parity, dollar dips after inflation surges
subheadlines: The dollar retraced from a 20-year high and the euro broke back above parity, following a brief dip below, after data on Wednesday showed U.S. consumer price inflation surged to a more than 40-year high in June.

title: Global regulators back 'same risk, same regulation' for stablecoins
subheadlines: Major stablecoins must comply with the same safeguards as traditional forms of payments, global regulators said on Wednesday, tightening controls over a battered crypto sector.

title: Global equities waver, oil falls amid recession fears
subheadlines: World stocks traded mixed while oil prices and bond yields dipped on Tuesday as traders fretted over prospects of further central bank tightening and worries about the health of economies worldwide.

title: U.S. Treasury seeks input on cryptocurrency risks, benefits
subheadlines: The U.S. Treasury on Tuesday said it was seeking comment on the on the risks and opportunities posed by digital assets as it seeks to prepare a report for President Joe Biden on the implications of developments such as cryptocurrencies.

title: Cryptoverse: Shrimps and whales keep bitcoin afloat
subheadlines: The shrimps of the crypto world have joined the whales in a glorious last stand to banish the bleak bitcoin winter.

title: U.S. SEC delays decision on ARK 21Shares spot bitcoin ETF
subheadlines: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Tuesday delayed a decision on whether to allow a spot bitcoin exchange-traded fund by stock-picker Cathie Wood's Arc Invest and crypto investment product firm 21Shares US to list and trade on Cboe Global Markets until Aug. 30.

title: Euro bounces from brink of parity with US dollar
subheadlines: The euro rebounded on Tuesday after sliding to a 20-year low and nearing parity against the U.S. dollar as investors worried that an energy crisis in the region would bring on a recession.

title: Crypto gaming firm Animoca Brands hits $5.5 billion valuation after $75 million fundraise
subheadlines: Blockchain game developer Animoca Brands has raised $75.3 million following a fundraising drive that now values the firm at A$8.2 billion ($5.5 billion) even as the market reels from a collapse in cryptocurrency prices.

title: Texas grid avoids blackouts with voluntary cutbacks amid scorching heat
subheadlines: Texas's power grid operator held off from imposing rolling blackouts on Monday using voluntary cutbacks and appeals to conserve energy as scorching triple-digit temperatures hit much of the state.

title: Factbox: Singapore's rise, and falter, as Asia cryptocurrency hub
subheadlines: Singapore's burgeoning cryptocurrency sector has been shaken by the recent collapse of Three Arrows Capital, a cryptocurrency hedge fund, and signs of tighter scrutiny by regulators at the Monetary Authority of Singapore.

title: Euro drops to 20-year low, approaches parity with dollar
subheadlines: The euro slid to a 20-year low and came closer to parity against the dollar on Monday on concerns that an energy crisis will tip the region into a recession, while the U.S. currency was boosted by expectations that the Federal Reserve will hike rates faster and further than peers.

title: Binance served crypto traders in Iran despite U.S. sanctions, clients say
subheadlines: The world's largest crypto exchange, Binance, continued to process trades by clients in Iran despite U.S. sanctions and a company ban on doing business there, a Reuters investigation has found.

title: G20 watchdog to propose first global crypto rules in October
subheadlines: The Financial Stability Board (FSB) said on Monday it would propose "robust" global rules for cryptocurrencies in October, following recent turmoil in markets that has highlighted the need to regulate the "speculative" sector.

subheadlines: The cryptocurrency industry needs strong regulation before it becomes so pervasive it poses financial stability risks, Federal Reserve Vice Chair Lael Brainard said on Friday, noting recent turmoil in the space has shown cryptocurrencies suffer from the same risks as the traditional finance sector.

title: Lawsuit accuses troubled crypto lender Celsius Network of fraud
subheadlines: A former investment manager at Celsius Network sued the crypto lender on Thursday, saying it used customer deposits to rig the price of its own crypto token and failed to properly hedge risk, causing it to freeze customer assets.

title: Bitcoin rises 6.1% to $21,792
subheadlines: Bitcoin rose 6.06% to $21,792.16 at 20:02 GMT on Thursday, adding $1,244.71 to its previous close.

title: Dollar little changed as traders await key U.S. data
subheadlines: The dollar was little changed after the euro briefly slid to a new two-decade low on Thursday, and sterling held to gains after Boris Johnson said he was quitting as British prime minister.

title: Dollar gains, euro falls as energy drives currency swings
subheadlines: The dollar rose to fresh 20-year highs on Wednesday and the euro tumbled to a new two-decade low as rising energy prices cast a long shadow over the euro zone's economy but bolstered the U.S. currency's safe-haven appeal.

title: Crypto exchange FTX has "a few billion" to support industry - Bankman-Fried
subheadlines: Sam Bankman-Fried, head of one of the largest cryptocurrency exchanges, FTX, said he and his company still have a "few billion" on hand to shore up struggling firms that could further destabilize the digital asset industry, but that the worst of the liquidity crunch has likely passed.

title: India's cryptocurrency industry reels as new tax hammers trading
subheadlines: India's new cryptocurrency tax has dealt a heavy blow to the country's crypto exchanges, adding to broader sectoral woes and sending trading volumes plunging by up to 90%.

title: Hacker claims to have stolen 1 bln records of Chinese citizens from police
subheadlines: A hacker has claimed to have procured a trove of personal information from the Shanghai police on one billion Chinese citizens, which tech experts say, if true, would be one of the biggest data breaches in history.

title: Cryptoverse: The bonfire of the NFTs
subheadlines: The NFT dream isn't dead, but it's taken a big non-fungible beating.

title: Euro slumps to two-decade low, oil tumbles as recession fears intensify
subheadlines: The euro sank on Tuesday to its weakest level against the dollar in almost 20 years while oil futures tumbled and bond prices rose as investors sought safety after the latest data fueled fears of a global economic slowdown.

title: Explainer: EU agrees rulebook for 'Wild West' crypto markets
subheadlines: The European Union on Thursday reached a provisional deal on the world's first set of comprehensive rules to regulate what one lawmaker called the "Wild West" crypto market.

title: South Korean man jailed over proceeds from child porn site, Yonhap reports
subheadlines: A South Korean court on Tuesday sentenced a man convicted of running one of the world's largest child pornography websites to a further two years in prison for concealing proceeds from the site, the Yonhap news agency reported.

title: Crypto asset manager Hilbert Capital names Cevian's Murray as CEO
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency asset manager Hilbert Capital has hired former Cevian Capital executive Richard Murray as CEO, it said on Tuesday.

title: Singapore-based crypto lender Vauld suspends withdrawals
subheadlines: Singapore-based crypto lending and trading platform Vauld said on Monday it would suspend withdrawals and trading and seek new investors, the latest sign of stress in the embattled crypto industry.

title: Central African Republic President: Crypto is key to financial inclusion
subheadlines: Cryptocurrencies are the solution to tackling financial exclusion in the Central African Republic, its President Faustin-Archange Touadera said on Sunday, citing the cost of opening bank accounts.

title: EU agrees to tame 'Wild West' with new crypto market rules
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency companies will need a licence and customer safeguards to issue and sell digital tokens in the European Union under groundbreaking new rules agreed by the bloc to tame a volatile "Wild West" market.

title: Second half begins with rally in stocks, fall in yields
subheadlines: The second half of the year started with gains in global stock indexes on Friday ahead of the long U.S. holiday weekend, while the 10-year Treasury yield fell the most since COVID-19 hit markets in March 2020.

title: Crypto lender Voyager Digital suspends withdrawals, deposits
subheadlines: Crypto lender Voyager Digital said on Friday it has suspended withdrawals, trading and deposits to its platform andsaid it is exploring strategic alternatives to preserve the value of its platform.

title: Dollar boosted by safety bid on rising recession fears
subheadlines: Pessimism about the global economicoutlook boosted demand for the safe-haven U.S. dollar on Friday while the Australian dollar, a proxy for global growth, tumbled to a two-year low.

title: U.S. CFTC charges South African company with record $1.7 billion bitcoin fraud
subheadlines: The U.S. commodities regulator announced on Thursday it had filed civil charges against a South African man and his company for operating a fradulent commodity pool worth over $1.7 billion in bitcoin.

title: Crypto lender Celsius says it is exploring options
subheadlines: Retail crypto lending platform Celsius Network said on Thursday it was exploring options including deals and restructuring its liabilities.

title: Riksbanken rate hike lifts Swedish crown
subheadlines: The Swedish crown rose on Thursday against the euro after Sweden's central bank hiked its benchmark interest rate by 50 basis points as expected.

title: MSCI global stock index has biggest first-half drop on record

subheadlines: Grayscale Investments' lawsuit against the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission for nixing the digital asset manager's proposal to create a spot bitcoin exchange-traded fund will likely be decided within a year, the company's chief executive officer said on Thursday.

title: Singapore regulator rebukes crypto fund Three Arrows Capital
subheadlines: Singapore's financial regulator has accused embattled crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital of exceeding its assets threshold and providing false information.

title: Basel revises bank crypto capital plan to include blockchain
subheadlines: Banks should take a conservative approach to setting aside capital to cover risks from "unbacked" crypto assets on their books, the global Basel Committee of banking regulators said in proposals on Thursday which now also cover blockchain.

title: Riksbanken rate hike lifts Swedish crown
subheadlines: The Swedish crown rose on Thursday against the euro after Sweden's central bank hiked its benchmark interest rate by 50 basis points as expected.

title: Buckle Up: How investors can deal with crypto turbulence
subheadlines: When Doug Milnes started buying cryptocurrencies in January of this year, he felt like it could become an entirely new asset class for investors.

title: Jacobi Asset Management to launch Europe's first bitcoin ETF on Euronext
subheadlines: Jacobi Asset Management said on Thursday that it would launch Europe's first bitcoin exchange-traded-fund (ETF) on the Euronext exchange, in a sign of the cryptocurrency's appeal despite its volatile price swings.

title: Markets in H1: The almost perfect storm

title: Dollar gains, yields ease after Powell inflation comments
subheadlines: U.S. Treasury yields eased for a second consecutive day and the dollar rose on Wednesday after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said there is a risk the U.S. central bank's interest rate hikes will slow the economy too much, but the bigger risk is persistent inflation.

subheadlines: The euro fell and the dollar rose on Wednesday after U.S. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said the biggest risk to the U.S. economy is persistent inflation and not that interest rate hikes will slow the economy too much.

title: Crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital has entered liquidation, source says

title: Uber ex-security chief accused of hacking coverup must face fraud charges, judge rules
subheadlines: A federal judge on Tuesday said a former Uber Technologies Inc security chief must face wire fraud charges over his alleged role in trying to cover up a 2016 hacking that exposed personal information of 57 million passengers and drivers.

title: Stocks tumble after weak U.S. confidence data; oil gains

title: Euro dips as markets manage expectations of ECB rate hikes
subheadlines: The dollar climbed on Tuesday while the euro faltered after European Central Bank (ECB) President Christine Lagarde offered no fresh insight into the central bank's policy outlook.

title: U.S. stocks fall after recent big gains; oil, yields rise

title: Dollar retreats as markets rethink Fed rate bets, eye ECB hikes
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar struggled versus its major rivals on Monday as softening inflation expectations prompted a reassessment of the prospects for aggressive interest rate hikes but volatile markets cushioned a broader decline.

title: Bitcoin miners sell their holdings amid crypto winter's chill

title: U.S. crypto firm Harmony hit by $100 million heist

subheadlines: Crypto broker Voyager Digital Ltd has lowered its daily withdrawal limits to $10,000 from $25,000, according to an update on the company's website.

title: Binance scores Cristiano Ronaldo as partner for NFT push

title: Financial watchdogs should do more to protect crypto investors, Swiss regulator says

title: Crypto giant Tether to launch sterling-pegged stablecoin

title: Blockchain payment company Roxe to go public via $3.6 bln SPAC deal
subheadlines: Blank check company Goldenstone Acquisition Ltd said late on Tuesday that it has entered into a deal with blockchain-based payments company Roxe Holding Inc to take it public for a combined enterprise value of about $3.6 billion.

title: U.S. stocks jump 2% after recent selloff; yen drops vs dollar

title: Collapse of stablecoin TerraUSD sparks bold 'scheme liability' suit

title: Brazil's Ebanx lays off 20% of employees as cuts sweep tech sector

title: Tech company NCR fights antitrust lawsuit over crypto ATMs
subheadlines: Banking and financial technology company NCR Corp has asked a California federal judge to dismiss a lawsuit from payment processing provider U.S. Alliance Group Inc alleging antitrust violations in the cryptocurrency ATM market.

title: Anticipating U.S. downturn, Elon Musk details Tesla staff cuts
subheadlines: Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla , said a 10% cut in salaried staff at the electric car maker will happen over three months, as the world's richest man predicted a U.S. recession was more likely than not.

title: Crypto firm BlockFi signs $250 mln revolving credit agreement with FTX
subheadlines: BlockFi has signed a term sheet with digital asset exchange FTX for a $250 million revolving credit facility, the cryptocurrency firm's chief executive officer, Zac Prince, said in a tweet on Tuesday.

title: CFTC advocates for expansion of cryptocurrency market jurisdiction
subheadlines: Daniel L. Stein, Matthew F. Kluchenek and Anna R. Easter of Mayer Brown LLP discuss developments and proposals on regulating digital assets and addressing fraud in the digital asset market.

title: Crypto's latest meltdown leaves punters bruised and bewildered
subheadlines: For Jeremy Fong, U.S. crypto lender Celsius was an ideal place to stash his digital currency holdings - and earn some spending money from its double-digit interest rates along the way.

title: South Korea puts crypto company Terraform Labs' staff on no-fly list
subheadlines: Several employees of South Korea-based Terraform labs, the company behind the stablecoin TerraUSD, which collapsed last month and roiled cryptocurrency markets, cannot leave the country, prosecutors said.

title: Crypto fears now materialising, central bank body BIS says
subheadlines: Recent implosions in the cryptocurrency markets indicate that long-warned-about dangers of decentralised digital money are now materialising, the Bank for International Settlements has said.

title: Cryptoverse: Crypto lenders face a DeFi drubbing
subheadlines: Crypto lending may not be down and out, but it's certainly on the ropes.

title: Morning Bid: Why the calm in markets won't last
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in markets from Dhara Ranasinghe.

title: Crypto lender Babel Finance wins debt repayment reprieve after withdrawal freeze
subheadlines: Babel Finance, the Hong Kong-based crypto lender which suspended withdrawals and redemption of crypto assets on Friday, said it has reached an agreement with counterparties on the repayment of some debts to ease short-term liquidity.

title: Euro edges higher with focus on ECB, dollar retreats
subheadlines: The euro rose on Monday as markets focused on European Central Bank tools to fight fragmentation in the currency bloc, shrugging off the risk of political gridlock in France for now after President Emmanuel Macron lost an absolute majority in a parliamentary election.

title: Bitcoin holds near $20,000 as investors fear "domino effect"
subheadlines: The cryptocurrency industry was on edge on Monday as bitcoin held just above $20,000 and investors feared that problems at major crypto players could unleash a wider market shakeout.

title: Stocks stage small bounce as investors weigh cenbanks' next moves
subheadlines: Stock markets chalked up modest gains on Monday after last week's hefty losses as investors braced for a host of U.S. Federal Reserve speakers this week, where they could underline a commitment to fight inflation whatever rate pain required.

title: Morning Bid: Not quite "Together"
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in markets from Dhara Ranasinghe.

title: Bitcoin recovers, climbs 7.6% to pass $20,400
subheadlines: Bitcoin on Sunday rose around 7.6% to $20,404 from its previous close, signaling a recovery from a sharp drop on Saturday.

title: Bitcoin slides below $20,000 to lowest level in 18 months
subheadlines: Bitcoin tumbled more than 13% at one point on Saturday as it extended a slide on industry troubles.

title: Bitcoin last down 7.4% at $18,915
subheadlines: Bitcoin dropped 7.46% to $18,915.29 at 15:59 GMT on Saturday, losing $1,525.41 from its previous close.

title: Elon Musk sued for $258 billion over alleged Dogecoin pyramid scheme
subheadlines: Elon Musk was sued for $258 billion on Thursday by a Dogecoin investor who accused him of running a pyramid scheme to support the cryptocurrency.

title: Market positioning suggests more pain for equities despite rout, Bank of America says
subheadlines: A market trends indicator by BofA Securities fell to zero for the first time since the pandemic-induced mayhem in financial markets in 2020, signalling extreme bearishness as investors dumped credit and crypto assets.

title: Babel Finance suspends withdrawals as crypto markets slump

title: Column: Crypto crash exposes regulators' complacency

title: EXCLUSIVE State securities regulators investigating Celsius accounts freeze
subheadlines: State securities regulators in Alabama, Kentucky, New Jersey, Texas and Washington are investigating crypto lender Celsius Network's decision this week to suspend customer redemptions, Joseph Rotunda, enforcement director at the Texas State Securities Board told Reuters on Thursday.

title: Bitcoin falls 7.03% to $20,969.32
subheadlines: Bitcoin dropped 7.03% to $20,969.32 at 20:04 GMT on Thursday, losing $1,585.95 from its previous close.

title: Crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital fails to meet margin calls -FT
subheadlines: Singapore-based crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital failed to meet margin calls this past weekend as cryptocurrency prices slid, according to a report from the Financial Times.

title: Swiss franc soars after shock rate hike; pound rises
subheadlines: The Swiss franc soared against the dollar and the euro on Thursday after the Swiss National Bank delivered a surprise interest rate hike, while the British pound rose after the Bank of England delivered a rate hike of its own.

title: Analysis: U.S. crypto-lending firms likely to see greater regulation after Celsius troubles
subheadlines: Liquidity troubles at crypto lending platform Celsius Network, which have left its 1.7 million customers unable to redeem their assets, will increase U.S. regulatory pressure on the sector, which was already on the defensive amid other crises this year.

title: Swiss franc soars after shock rate hike; pound higher
subheadlines: The Swiss franc soared against the dollar and the euro on Thursday after the Swiss National Bank delivered a surprise interest rate hike, while the British pound rose after the Bank of England delivered a rate hike of its own.

title: Crypto giant Binance opens 2,000 positions for hiring - CEO
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance has opened 2,000 positions for hiring, Chief Executive Officer Changpeng Zhao said on Wednesday, a sharp contrast to a slew of job cuts by companies operating in the digital currency space.

title: Crypto stock short sellers up about 126% this year - S3 Partners

title: Bitcoin eases from 18-month low as crypto market stabilizes

title: Dollar dips as Fed hikes rates, flags slowing economy

title: Meeting fraudsters on the battlefield: The impact of fraud after the pandemic

title: How crypto lender Celsius stumbled on risky bank-like investments
subheadlines: Celsius Network, the retail crypto lending platform whose liquidity problems have sent cryptocurrencies plunging, stumbled on complex investments in the wholesale digital asset market in what analysts say was akin to a traditional bank run.

title: U.S. crypto broker Genesis says its lending business is meeting client demand
subheadlines: U.S. cryptocurrency dealer Genesis Trading said on Wednesday its balance sheet is strong and its lending business continues to meet client demand, days after rival lender Celsius Network sparked a crypto sell-off by freezing client withdrawals.

title: Crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital addresses liquidation rumours
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency hedge fund Three Arrows Capital said on Wednesday it was committed to working things out, seemingly addressing social media chatter that it is facing liquidation issues.

title: MicroStrategy scotches 'margin call' fears, says can withstand volatility
subheadlines: U.S. software developer MicroStrategy Inc said it has not received a margin call against a bitcoin-backed loan and can withstand further volatility, soothing market jitters after the token's slide raised fears of asset liquidation.

title: MicroStrategy says it has not received a margin call against loan
subheadlines: Software firm MicroStrategy said it has not received a margin call against its bitcoin-backed borrowing on Wednesday, and it has plenty of extra collateral to pledge if necessary.

title: Wall Street watchdog to laid-off crypto employees: work for us
subheadlines: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority plans to increase its resources to understand and monitor cryptocurrencies as more of the Wall Street watchdog's members trade digital assets, Chief Executive Officer Robert Cook said on Tuesday.

title: Fed risk drubs stocks; dollar, bond yields soar
subheadlines: World stocks fell for a second day in a row on Tuesday while government bond yields and the U.S. dollar clung to multi-year highs, as surging inflation led investors to brace for what could be the largest U.S. interest rate hike in 28 years this week.

title: Bitcoin stabilizes after heavy losses but pessimism reigns in crypto markets
subheadlines: Bitcoin steadied on Tuesday after earlier hitting a new 18-month low, as major crypto lender Celsius Network's freezing of withdrawals and the prospect of sharp U.S. interest rate rises shook the volatile asset class.

title: Dollar index jumps to two-decade high as traders await Fed rate move
subheadlines: The dollar hit a fresh two-decade high against a basket of currencies on Tuesday, as traders braced for an aggressive rate hike from the U.S. Federal Reserve this week to try to curb inflation.

title: El Salvador's bitcoin holdings value slashed in half by sell-off
subheadlines: El Salvador's bet on bitcoin was slashed on Tuesday by half as the more than $100 million in the country's publicly disclosed purchases dropped more than 50% in value.

title: Coinbase slashes 1,100 jobs as crypto winter sets in
subheadlines: Coinbase Global Inc will cut about 1,100 jobs, or 18% of its workforce, the cryptocurrency exchange said on Tuesday, the latest company preparing to ride out a downturn in the cryptosphere.

title: U.S. SEC chair Gensler says investors should beware of crypto returns that seem "too good to be true"
subheadlines: U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Gary Gensler said on Tuesday that investors should beware promised returns from crypto lending platforms and products that seem "too good to be true."

title: Cryptoverse: The funds making money from messy markets
subheadlines: The crypto market's a hot mess, leaving many investors struggling to turn a buck. Enter the arbitrageurs.

title: Column: Nowhere to run, nowhere to hide as 'stagflation' bites
subheadlines: Inflation and economic data are screaming at investors to run for the hills. But what if the hills are hard to find?

title: Morning Bid: Shockwaves, say no more
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in markets from Dhara Ranasinghe

title: Crypto contagion fears spread after Celsius Network freezes withdrawals
subheadlines: Bitcoin fell as much as 14% on Monday after major U.S. cryptocurrency lending company Celsius Network froze withdrawals and transfers citing "extreme" market conditions, in the latest sign of the financial market downturn hitting the cryptosphere.

title: El Salvador minister says Bitcoin crash poses 'extremely minimal' fiscal risk
subheadlines: El Salvador's Finance Minister Alejandro Zelaya on Monday dismissed concerns that a sharp drop in the value of bitcoin could hurt the Central American nation's fiscal health.

title: S&P 500 confirms bear market as recession worry grows
subheadlines: U.S. equities tumbled on Monday, with the S&P 500 confirming it is in a bear market, as fears grow that the expected aggressive interest rate hikes by the Federal Reserve would push the economy into a recession.

title: Inflation angst drags S&P 500 into bear market; bonds skid
subheadlines: Global stocks and government bonds plunged again on Monday and the dollar hit two-decade highs, as red-hot U.S. inflation fuelled worries about even more aggressive policy tightening in a big week for central banks.

title: Bitcoin falls 12.1% to $23,366
subheadlines: Bitcoin dropped 12.1% to $23,366 at 2002 GMT on Monday, losing $3,218.95 from its previous close.

title: Dollar at two-decade high as risky assets sell off; yen recovers ground
subheadlines: The safe-haven U.S. dollar rose to a fresh two-decade high against a basket of currencies on Monday, supported by fears of a global economic slowdown and bets on steep interest rate hikes by the U.S. Federal Reserve.

title: Binance U.S. exchange sued by crypto investor over stablecoin collapse
subheadlines: Binance U.S. and its CEO were sued on Monday by a U.S. investor who alleges the cryptocurrency exchange falsely marketed Terra USD as a safe asset ahead of the so-called stablecoin's collapse in value last month.

title: Cryptocurrency market value slumps under $1 trillion
subheadlines: The value of the cryptocurrency market on Monday fell below $1 trillion for the first time since January 2021, according to data site CoinMarketCap, reaching as low as $926 billion.

title: Explainer: The world of crypto lending
subheadlines: Major U.S. cryptocurrency lending company Celsius Network froze withdrawals and transfers on Monday, citing "extreme" market conditions, sparking a sell-off across crypto markets.

title: BoE's Bailey: latest crypto turmoil reinforces concerns
subheadlines: Bitcoin's slump on Monday after major U.S. crypto lending company Celsius Network froze withdrawals should remind investors that most crypto-assets have no intrinsic value, Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said.

title: Kenya, Nigeria central bankers criticise crypto, tout digital currencies
subheadlines: Cryptocurrencies pose risks to financial stability, but central bank digital currencies could solve problems such as bringing the poor into the financial system or cutting transaction costs, Kenyan and Nigerian central bankers said on Friday.

title: Dollar rises as hot U.S. inflation data seen keeping Fed hawkish
subheadlines: The dollar climbed to a near four-week high against a basket of currencies on Friday, after data showed U.S. consumer prices accelerated in May, strengthening expectations the Federal Reserve may have to continue with interest rate hikes through September to combat inflation.

title: Crypto regulation efforts need to keep pace with market growth -Bank of Canada official
subheadlines: The number of Canadians who own cryptoassets is growing rapidly and efforts to regulate the sector need to start keeping pace, a senior Bank of Canada official said, noting many people may not understand the risk of investing in products like bitcoin.

title: Dollar gains ahead of inflation data, euro falls after ECB
subheadlines: The dollar index rose for a second straight day on Thursday, erasing initial declines while the euro turned lower after the latest policy announcement by the European Central Bank (ECB), which signaled the bank was set to begin raising interest rates.

title: Shares slide as sentiment ebbs on rate fears, yields rise
subheadlines: U.S. and European stocks slid on Wednesday as the outlook for rate hikes sullied sentiment, while bond yields rose after euro-zone gross domestic product beat expectations, adding to bets of a more hawkish European Central Bank.

title: Dollar gains as U.S. stocks fall, ECB decision on tap
subheadlines: The dollar index gained on Wednesday, reversing earlier declines as U.S. equities fell and boosted the appeal of the safe haven, while the euro strengthened ahead of a European Central Bank policy announcement.

title: Singapore trading platform recognises crypto assets of accredited investors
subheadlines: Singapore-based private securities platform ADDX said it has become the first financial firm in the city-state to recognise cryptocurrency in their assessment of assets of high-net worth clients.

title: Dollar dips as hopes rise that inflation has peaked
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar index retreated from earlier highs and fell on Tuesday as Wall Street stocks erased initial declines amid growing hopes that inflation may have peaked, but the greenback managed to hit its highest level in 20 years against the Japanese yen.

title: PayPal allows transfer of crypto to external wallets
subheadlines: PayPal Holdings Inc said on Tuesday it will now allow users to transfer cryptocurrencies including bitcoin to external wallets, nearly two years after the fintech giant opened up its platform to digital currencies.

title: Special Report: How crypto giant Binance became a hub for hackers, fraudsters and drug traffickers
subheadlines: In September 2020, a North Korean hacking group known as Lazarus broke into a small Slovakian crypto exchange and stole virtual currency worth some $5.4 million. It was one of a string of cyber heists by Lazarus that Washington said were aimed at funding North Korea's nuclear weapons programme.

title: Cryptoverse: The early birds betting bitcoin's bottoming out
subheadlines: As the crypto winter creeps into June, the first signs of a thaw are emerging.

title: Benfica to join crypto craze with Socios
subheadlines: Portugal's biggest soccer club, Benfica, will become the country's first to join the crypto craze, partnering with blockchain-powered fan engagement firm Socios.com to launch a fan token, the club announced on Tuesday.

title: Dollar gains as risk appetite fades, inflation data eyed
subheadlines: The dollar gained against a basket of major currencies on Monday as risk appetite waned from earlier levels, with U.S. stocks well off their earlier highs to increase the appeal of the safe haven ahead of a key reading on inflation later in the week.

title: NY bill aims to limit crypto miners using fossil fuel-generated power
subheadlines: The New York State Legislature has passed a bill that would impose a two-year moratorium on the use of fossil-fuel power plants to provide energy to miners of cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, but Governor Kathy Hochul's office on Monday said she had not yet decided whether to sign it.

title: Bitcoin gains over 5% to $31,441.76
subheadlines: Bitcoin rose 5.2% to $31,441.76 at 2000 GMT on Monday, adding $1,552.78 to its previous close.

title: Crypto scam victims lose more than $1 billion since 2021, FTC says
subheadlines: More than 46,000 people reported losing over $1 billion in cryptocurrency scams since the start of 2021, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) said in a report on Friday.

title: Dollar advances as U.S. job growth tops expectations
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar rose against a basket of currencies on Friday after a better-than-expected U.S. employment report pointed to a tight labor market that could keep the Federal Reserve on an aggressive path of interest rate hikes.

title: Dollar falls as investors reach for riskier currencies
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar fell across the board on Thursday, ceding ground gained in recent sessions as firmer risk sentiment prompted investors to reach for higher-yielding currencies.

title: U.S. CFTC sues crypto exchange Gemini over 2017 statements
subheadlines: The U.S. CFTC filed a federal lawsuit in New York on Tuesday accusing Gemini Trust Co of making false and misleading statements concerning a bitcoin futures contract the firm was pursuing in 2017.

title: Bitcoin drops 6.9% to below $30,000
subheadlines: Bitcoin, the world's biggest and best-known cryptocurrency, dropped 6.9% to $29,555.35 at 22:03 GMT on Wednesday, losing $2,262.81 from its previous closing price.

title: No 'red line' against central bank digital currency, BoE's Hauser says
subheadlines: A central bank digital currency (CBDC) would not pose too big a challenge for the Bank of England's operations, Andrew Hauser, the BoE's executive director for markets, said on Wednesday.

title: Binance's venture capital arm raises $500 mln fund to invest in Web3, blockchain
subheadlines: Binance Labs, the venture capital arm of cryptocurrency exchange Binance, said on Wednesday it had raised $500 million for its investment fund focused on companies involved in the blockchain and Web3 spaces.

title: Fidelity's crypto unit to double down on hiring this year

title: New York couple accused of laundering $4.5 bln in crypto still in plea talks
subheadlines: A New York couple accused of laundering $4.5 billion in cryptocurrency tied to the 2016 hack of digital currency exchange Bitfinex are still negotiating a possible plea deal while reviewing more than 1.1 gigabytes of evidence in the case, prosecutors said.

title: Dollar rises as inflation worries hurt risk sentiment
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar strengthened across the board on Tuesday as Treasury yields climbed and worries over a further acceleration in global inflation depressed investors' risk appetite.

title: Global regulators push ahead with crypto bank capital rules
subheadlines: Global regulators said on Tuesday they will complete work by year end on how much capital banks should hold to cover cryptoassets on their books.

title: Wild swings of May not necessarily the end of market turmoil
subheadlines: Sell in May? They certainly did, but rather than go away as the old stock market adage suggests, traders returned to aggressively buy the dip, causing some of the wildest monthly swings in recent times.

title: Cryptoverse: Will you grow old with bitcoin?
subheadlines: If you assumed crypto was just a young person's game, think again.

title: Bitcoin surges nearly 8% to $31,780
subheadlines: Bitcoin rose 7.93 % to $31,780.51 at 2200 GMT on Monday, up $2,334.8 from its previous close.

title: Bitcoin lures inflation-weary Argentines despite crypto crash
subheadlines: In the Crypstation cafe in downtown Buenos Aires, trendy young Argentines order their lattes and pastries surrounded by screens with real-time cryptocurrency price quotes and a huge neon Bitcoin logo. The bill can be paid in digital money, too.

title: Dollar slides for second week as traders adjust Fed rate hike views
subheadlines: The dollar edged lower on Friday on its way to a second-straight weekly decline as traders pared expectations for U.S. Federal Reserve interest rate hikes and as improving inflation and consumer spending data eased recession fears.

title: U.S. SEC rejects carbon-neutral bitcoin ETF by One River

subheadlines: The world is moving rapidly toward increasing use of digital payments and an official digital version of the U.S. dollar could help safeguard its global dominance as other countries issue their own, Federal Reserve Vice Chair Lael Brainard said on Thursday.

title: Dollar eases as traders scale back bets on Fed tightening
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar edged lower on Thursday as markets considered whether the Federal Reserve might slow or even pause its tightening cycle in the second half of the year, which would weaken the allure of the safehaven currency.

title: Get your crypto house in order, old guard tells Davos debutantes
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency firms, many of which lined the main street in Davos this week, were told they will need to clean up their act before gaining complete acceptance from the World Economic Forum's old guard.

title: Fed's Brainard sees case for central bank digital currency
subheadlines: Creating an official digital version of the U.S. dollar could help ensure financial system stability as crypo-assets and digital currencies developed by other countries become increasingly popular, Federal Reserve Vice Chair Lael Brainard said on Wednesday.

title: Blockchain tech firm StarkWare raises $100 mln, valued at $8 bln

title: Crypto lender Babel Finance valued at $2 billion after latest fundraising

title: Andreessen Horowitz raises $4.5 billion for fourth crypto fund

title: Column: Crypto regulators may see 10% household exposure as high watermark
subheadlines: Whatever the broader financial or economic stability risks of volatile crypto tokens, government watchdogs may reasonably balk at 10% household exposure to loosely-regulated speculative punts that double or halve in value every 6 months.

title: Cryptocurrency crash devalues Ukraine's government crypto fundraise
subheadlines: Ukraine, battered by three months of war, plans to continue to tap crypto investors to help raise funds after a plunge in prices decimated the country’s fundraising efforts in May.

title: Cryptoverse: Is the end of the bitcoin winter nigh?
subheadlines: The crypto winter is into its ninth week and bitcoin can't shake the chills.

title: Stocks tumble on growth concerns, bond yields slip
subheadlines: Shares slid worldwide on Tuesday as supply chain woes and surging costs hurt corporate earnings and manufacturing output slowed, while Treasury yields dipped as the weakness in equities revived a safe-haven bid for U.S. government debt.

title: Crypto markets may pose risks to wider financial stability, ECB warns
subheadlines: Cryptocurrencies will pose a risk to financial stability if the emerging sector maintains its rapid growth of the last two years and financial firms deepen their involvement, the European Central Bank (ECB) said on Tuesday.

title: Central African Republic to launch bitcoin investment platform

title: What you need to know about Davos on Monday
subheadlines: The World Economic Forum returned to Davos on Monday with a unique spring gathering. Here is what you need to know about Day 1:

title: Crypto crowd dominate Davos main street despite price crash
subheadlines: A free bitcoin pizza stall and a "Liquidity Lounge" were among the treats on offer for attendees at this year's meeting in Davos, where blockchain and cryptocurrency firms have taken over its main street, despite a recent crash in digital coin values.

title: Stocks rally as euro gains on likely rate hikes

title: Smaller, warmer Davos confronts a siloed world
subheadlines: The World Economic Forum is showing signs of a more siloed world. Political, business and financial leaders and their entourages are convening in Davos, Switzerland this week after a delay of more than two years. Pandemic, war, and the unusual spring slot help explain some notable absences. As economies turn inward and markets tumble, founder Klaus Schwab’s knack for brokering cross-border relationships faces a stiff test.

title: Global stocks rebound despite unease over economy; dollar gains
subheadlines: Global equity markets rebounded after the S&P 500 pared losses that briefly took it into bear market territory, and the dollar gained on Friday, as investor unease about Federal Reserve policy tightening to curb inflation kindled fears of a recession.

title: Dollar selling takes a pause after bruising week
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar recouped some of its losses against the euro on Friday, but remained set for its worst weekly performance against the common currency since early February as investors questioned whether the greenback's month-long rally was done.

title: Bitcoin rises 5.3% to $30,205
subheadlines: Bitcoin rose 5.33% to $30,204.92 at 2201 GMT on Thursday, adding $1,530.09 to its previous close.

title: El Salvador's credibility would benefit from IMF deal - Moody's

title: Can blockchain offer solutions for cross-border trade and supply chain disruptions?

subheadlines: Reckoning they have little to lose with prices so ridiculously low, South Korean speculators in recent days have piled into Luna, a cryptocurrency that lost 99.99% of its value last week after its paired stablecoin TerraUSD collapsed.

title: Dollar recovers ground as risk appetite fades
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar rose on Wednesday, on pace to snap a three-session losing streak, as concerns about the outlook for global economic growth and rising inflation knocked sentiment a day after U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell struck a more hawkish tone.

title: Mexican cryptocurrency platform Bitso launches in Colombia

title: Morning Bid: Extreme fear? Seriously?
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in markets from Julien Ponthus.

title: Dollar slips as risk appetite returns

title: Bank of England's Cunliffe warns of more tough times for crypto
