title: Small players lose faith in crypto after sell-off
subheadlines: Nofe Isah, a 25-year old based in Nigeria, has been investing in crypto since January. Last week, she lost all of her $5,000 in savings as cryptocurrency luna went into free fall.

title: Yields slip, stocks struggle as economic fears grow
subheadlines: Shockingly weak data from China underlined the deep damage from lockdowns.

title: U.S. SEC chair says much to be done to protect crypto investors
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency assets are highly speculative and investors in them need more protections or they could lose trust in the markets, Gary Gensler, chair of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, said on Monday.

title: Jupiter, Yarbrough among investors who sold Coinbase before big fall
subheadlines: Jupiter Asset Management, Azora Capital LP and billionaire Jon Yarbrough's family office were among funds that sold all of their stakes in cryptocurrency company Coinbase Global Inc before the company fell nearly 30% to record lows in early May, according to filings released on Monday.

title: Dollar slips from 2-decade highs; yuan falls on weak China data
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar index was lower on Monday after hitting a 20-year peak last week, with the global economy in focus after weak economic data from China highlighted worries about the prospects for a global slowdown.

title: Backer of stricken TerraUSD says spent reserves trying to salvage dollar peg
subheadlines: An affiliate of the company behind collapsed stablecoin TerraUSD on Monday said it had spent the bulk of its reserves trying to defend its dollar peg last week and would use what little remained to compensate some users who had lost out.

title: Morning Bid: COVID lockdowns may end but China is still sneezing
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in markets from Sujata Rao.

title: Grayscale to launch digital assets ETF in UK, Italy, Germany
subheadlines: Grayscale will list an exchange-traded fund (ETF) in Europe made up of companies representing the "Future of Finance", the world's largest cryptocurrency asset manager said in a statement on Monday.

title: Take Five: Recession talk justified? Follow the data
subheadlines: A deluge of data from across major economies comes at a pivotal moment in the debate over whether central banks are jacking up interest rates into a potentially sharp global growth slowdown.

title: FTX's billionaire chief says bitcoin has no future as a payments network, Financial Times reports
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX's founder has said that bitcoin has no future as a payments network and criticized the digital currency for its inefficiency and high environmental costs, the Financial Times reported on Monday.

title: Analysis: Trudeau foe attacks Bank of Canada in party leadership bid
subheadlines: The front-runner to head Canada's Conservatives and likely challenger to Liberal Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is staging a rare series of attacks on the central bank as inflation soars, in a strategy to win party leadership that could hurt his chances in a general election.

title: Nigeria's markets regulator publishes rules on crypto assets
subheadlines: Nigeria's markets regulator has published a set of regulations for digital assets, signalling Africa's most populous country is trying to find a middle ground between an outright ban on crypto assets and their unregulated use.

title: Central African bank regulator reminds states of crypto ban
subheadlines: Central Africa's regional banking regulator sent out a reminder on Friday about its ban on cryptocurrencies, weeks after the Central African Republic, a member state, made bitcoin legal tender.

title: World equities rise on bounce in U.S., European markets
subheadlines: Global shares rose on Friday as Wall Street rallied to end a volatile week of trading, while oil jumped 4% on the back of record-high U.S. gas prices.

title: Crypto world stabilizes after rocky week shakes stablecoins

title: Dollar dips to end trading week but set for weekly gain
subheadlines: The dollar slipped on Friday as a rally in equities contributed to a risk-on mood, but was still set for a sixth straight week of gains as investors remained concerned about slowing global growth and Federal Reserve policy tilting the United States into a recession.

title: Morning Bid: TGIF - is it over yet?
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in markets from Dhara Ranasinghe.

title: Nomura offers its first bitcoin derivatives, just as crypto markets tumble
subheadlines: Nomura has begun offering bitcoin over-the-counter derivatives to clients, it said Friday, the latest move by a traditional financial institution into the cryptocurrency industry, even as markets are in turmoil.

title: Column: 'Mom & pop' investors left high and dry in tech, crypto meltdown: McGeever
subheadlines: It's almost a cliche that retail investors are always late to an investment boom - but the outsize exposure of household savers to frothier elements of frenzied markets since lockdown means they are feeling the hit from this bust more than most.

title: World shares sink as inflation, economic fears persist
subheadlines: World equities fell on Thursday to an 18-month-low, with markets dogged by fears high inflation would persist and force central banks to keep tightening monetary policy.

title: Crypto collapse intensifies as stablecoin Tether slides below dollar peg

title: Crypto meltdown deepens as stablecoin Tether drops below dollar peg
subheadlines: The meltdown in TerraUSD, one of the world's largest stablecoins, sent shockwaves through cryptocurrency markets.

title: Global growth worries send dollar to new 20-yr high
subheadlines: The dollar climbed to a fresh 20-year high on Thursday as concerns persisted that central bank actions to drive down high inflation would crimp global economic growth, boosting the currency's safe-haven appeal.

title: Explainer: What are stablecoins, the asset rocking the cryptocurrency market?
subheadlines: Most cryptocurrencies have a major problem with price volatility, but one sub-category of coins is designed to maintain a constant value: stablecoins.

title: Factbox: U.S. companies and their cryptocurrency holdings
subheadlines: A meltdown in one of the world's largest stablecoins, TerraUSD, sent shockwaves through cryptocurrency markets on Thursday, wiping out bitcoin's 2021 gains and sending it to a 16-month low.

title: Morning Bid: Still too hot
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead from Danilo Masoni.

title: Global crypto regulation body likely in next year, top official says
subheadlines: Global market regulators are likely to launch a joint body within the next year to better co-ordinate cryptocurrency rules, a senior watchdog official has said.

title: Bitcoin falls 7.2% to $28,758
subheadlines: Bitcoin fell 7.23% to $28,758.29 at 22:05 GMT on Wednesday, losing $2,241.68 from its previous close.

title: Dollar slips after CPI data as Fed expectations in check
subheadlines: The dollar was lower on Wednesday after economic data showed inflation remained high but was unlikely to lead the Federal Reserve to shift to a more aggressive path of monetary policy.

title: Coinbase is conjoined to crypto
subheadlines: Coinbase Global went for a ride when digital collectibles like Bitcoin soared. The excitement meant more customers, rising trading volumes and rocketing fees. Last year’s revenue was 14 times higher than 2019. First quarter earnings on Tuesday show everything has now switched into reverse, and hard.

title: Stablecoin crash drags crypto ideals back to earth
subheadlines: Do Kwon had one job. The self-titled “master of stablecoin” designed a popular digital token, TerraUSD, that was supposedly pegged to the dollar. On Wednesday its value slumped below 30 cents. The collapse brings highfalutin cryptocurrency ideals back to earth.

title: Coinbase new disclosure does not mean firm faces bankruptcy risk, says CEO
subheadlines: Coinbase chief executive said a disclosure in its latest quarterly filing did not indicate the largest U.S. cryptocurrency exchange faced a bankruptcy risk, and it had been made to meet a regulatory requirement.

title: Analysis: Blockchain needs MP3 music moment to win over markets
subheadlines: Blockchain needs its own music industry 'MP3' moment as fragmented regulation and technology hamper the development of a digital securities industry that could help realise its full potential, industry officials said.

title: Explainer: Does the cryptocurrency crash pose a threat to the financial system?
subheadlines: On Tuesday, bitcoin fell briefly below $30,000 for the first time in 10 months, while cryptocurrencies overall have lost nearly $800 billion in market value in the past month, according to data site CoinMarketCap, as investors fret about tightening monetary policy.

title: Cryptoverse: Buying the dip? Bitcoin's a rates rookie
subheadlines: Bitcoin has scant experience with rising interest rates, posing perils for investors looking to capitalize on its dramatic drop.

title: Equities bounce back while yields, oil prices drop
subheadlines: Wall Street closed higher on Tuesday as investors waited for inflation data and worried about the prospects of slowing economic growth and the impact of policy tightening.

title: Coinbase misses revenue estimates as retail investors head for the door
subheadlines: Coinbase Global Inc missed estimates for first-quarter revenue on Tuesday and posted a loss as turmoil in global markets curbed investor appetite for risk assets including trading in cryptocurrencies.

title: Dollar higher in choppy trade as inflation data eyed

title: Crypto assets shed $800 billion in market value in a month
subheadlines: Crypto assets bled nearly $800 billion in market value over the past month, touching a low of $1.4 trillion on Tuesday, according to data site CoinMarketCap, as the end of easy monetary policy diminishes appetite for risk assets.

title: Crypto exchange KuCoin valued at $10 billion in latest funding round
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency exchange KuCoin raised $150 million in a series B funding round led by Jump Crypto, the company said on Tuesday, giving it a valuation of $10 billion.

title: Commodity currencies bounce back but sentiment remains fragile
subheadlines: Commodity currencies Norwegian crown and the Australian dollar recovered some ground on Tuesday after hitting their lowest levels in nearly two years against the U.S. dollar, tracking a rebound in European and Chinese stock markets.

title: Stocks and oil dive as investors hunt safe havens
subheadlines: Stock indexes around the world fell sharply, oil prices sank about 6% and the dollar finished just off a 20-year high as investors fled risk and sought safe havens due to worries about inflation and slower global economic growth.

title: Bitcoin falls 9.58% to $30,736.94
subheadlines: Bitcoin dropped 9.58% to $30,736.94 at 22:02 GMT on Monday, losing $3,261.03 from its previous close.

title: Bitcoin drops as Wall Street shares tumble
subheadlines: Bitcoin plunged to its lowest level since July 2021 on Monday, dropping in tandem with slumping U.S. equity markets amid concerns about the Federal Reserve's aggressive tightening path.

title: Bitcoin falls 7.8% to $31,333
subheadlines: Bitcoin dropped 7.81% to $31,333.41 at 20:03 GMT on Monday, losing $2,655.98 from its previous close.

title: Morning Bid: How far behind the curve exactly?
subheadlines: A look at the day ahead in markets from Julien Ponthus.

title: Stocks slide, long-dated yields rise on inflation concerns
subheadlines: Long-dated U.S. Treasury yields surged and global stock markets slid further on Friday as investors worried the Federal Reserve may not be able to curb inflation in the years ahead even as U.S. data showed decelerating wage growth in April.

title: Dollar index slips from 20-year high, Fed rate path in focus
subheadlines: The dollar slipped against a basket of currencies on Friday after two volatile days as investors focused on how aggressive the Federal Reserve might be in hiking rates as it tackles rising inflation.

title: Uganda's central bank weighs issuance of digital currency
subheadlines: Uganda's central bank is considering whether to issue a digital currency and has not banned cryptocurrencies, but has concerns about risks from the technology including consumer protection and financial inclusion, a senior bank official said on Friday.

title: Stars align for UAE to become a global crypto hub
subheadlines: Dubai and Abu Dhabi are making a play for the cryptocurrency crown. Big crypto exchanges like FTX, last valued at $32 billion, are setting up shop in Dubai. There are a number of reasons why it might be to their taste.

title: Dorsey-led Block beats operating profit estimates, shares surge 10%
subheadlines: Block Inc , the fintech firm led by Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey, said on Thursday it had not seen a decline in overall consumer spending through April, after reporting a first-quarter operating profit that topped Wall Street targets.

subheadlines: U.S. Treasury yields jumped and global equity markets tanked on Thursday, erasing the prior day's rally on Wall Street, as investors worried aggressive central bank policies around the world to tamp down inflation could easily shackle growth.

title: Column: Crypto warnings invoke U.S. subprime bust, 2008, and all that
subheadlines: Regulators comparing the crypto craze to the U.S. subprime mortgage bust of the 2000s may seem like scaremongering, but the more crypto integrates with traditional investing and markets, the more prescient these warning may become.

title: Gucci jumps on the crypto bandwagon with U.S. project
subheadlines: Gucci's high-end handbags and other luxury products can now be bought using cryptocurrencies, including bitcoin, in some U.S. stores, the Italian company said, as digital currencies move to broader acceptance.

title: Stocks rally after Fed hikes rates, crude jumps
subheadlines: U.S. stocks rallied and Treasury yields fell on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve raised interest rates by 50 basis points as expected and said it would begin to reduce its balance sheet in June in a decision seen as less hawkish than some feared.

title: Bitcoin last up 5.7% at $39,862.84
subheadlines: Bitcoin rose 5.7% to $39,862.84, on Wednesday, adding $2,102.94 to its previous close.

title: EV firm Atlis plans U.S. stock market listing amid IPO drought
subheadlines: Atlis Motor Vehicles has become the latest startup in the electric-vehicle space to unveil plans for an initial public offering as the global push towards electrification accelerates.

title: Binance registers with France crypto regulator, advances European plans
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance has registered with France's market regulator, Chief Executive Officer Changpeng Zhao said in a tweet on Wednesday, advancing the company's plan to make Paris its European base.

title: Goldman’s financial alchemy extends to crypto too
subheadlines: Trust Goldman Sachs to find an angle for investment banks in the cryptocurrency sector. David Solomon’s $100 billion group made a bitcoin-backed loan to $27 billion exchange Coinbase Global , people familiar with the matter told Breakingviews. The structure means Goldman won’t touch crypto-assets. Assuming regulators don’t object, the rest of Wall Street will pile in.

title: Uzbekistan legalises solar-powered crypto mining
subheadlines: Uzbekistan will allow companies to mine cryptocurrencies using solar energy and will exempt all crypto operations by domestic and foreign companies from income tax, according to a presidential decree published this week.

title: Factbox: European 'flash crash' was latest of many globally over the past decade
subheadlines: The sudden drop in European shares on Monday following an erroneous trade in the Nordic markets is the latest example of a "flash crash" in which the price of an asset quickly drops before bouncing back.

title: Cryptoverse: Venture capitalists catch crypto fever
subheadlines: Venture capital is making a big move on crypto in 2022.

title: Stocks rise, U.S. yields slip as markets await Fed rate hike
subheadlines: A gauge of global equity markets edged higher on Tuesday while 10-year U.S. Treasury yields slid from the 3% level as investors remained cautious, expecting the Federal Reserve to hike rates by the most in a single day since 2000 to curb inflation.

title: Bitcoin’s African outpost raises several red flags
subheadlines: Bitcoin’s latest fans are about as far as you can get from Silicon Valley crypto bros. War-torn Central African Republic (CAR) on Wednesday adopted the digital currency as legal tender . It’s even odder than when El Salvador did the same thing last year. The surprise expressed by the region’s central bank and President Faustin-Archange Touadéra’s military reliance on Russian mercenaries are red flags. Bitcoin’s path to the currency mainstream just became thornier.

title: Trademark and copyright considerations for NFTs
subheadlines: Sharon Urias of Greenspoon Marder LLP discusses common and novel questions regarding copyrights and trademarks in relation to the purchase of NFTs.

title: Buffett reveals big investments, rails against Wall Street excess at Berkshire meeting
subheadlines: The meeting was Berkshire Hathaway's first to welcome shareholders since COVID derailed the gathering for two years.

title: U.S. dollar net long bets rise, bitcoin posts largest net long since CME launch -CFTC, Reuters
subheadlines: Speculators' net long positioning on the U.S. dollar rose in the latest week, according to calculations by Reuters and U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission data released on Friday.

title: GRAT planning with crypto: volatile relationship or match made in heaven?
subheadlines: Eric N. Mann and Gina Shkoukani of Neal Gerber Eisenberg discuss trusts and estates planning with cryptocurrency.

title: Swiss National Bank opposed to holding bitcoin as a reserve currency
subheadlines: The Swiss National Bank is against buying and holding bitcoin as a reserve currency, Chairman Thomas Jordan said at the central bank's annual general meeting on Friday.

title: Crypto moves herald era of the blockchain buyout
subheadlines: Private equity groups have sat on the sidelines of the crypto boom, which has seen the value of bitcoin and ether rally by 400% and 1,400% over the past two years. An EY survey found that only 3% of the largest buyout firms had invested in crypto-related assets.

title: EU watchdog targets misleading online financial promotions

title: Dollar hits 20-yr high as yen tumbles on dovish Bank of Japan

title: Analysis: Bitcoin adoption by Central African Republic baffles cryptoverse

title: Cryptoverse: Ether prepares for epic 'merge' in quest to eclipse bitcoin

title: Canadian dollar to stay at core of financial system, not crypto -BoC

title: Special Report: How crypto giant Binance built ties to a Russian FSB-linked agency
subheadlines: In April 2021, Russia's financial intelligence unit met in Moscow with the regional head of Binance, the world's largest crypto exchange. The Russians wanted Binance to agree to hand over client data, including names and addresses, to help them fight crime, according to text messages the company official sent to a business associate.

subheadlines: A fledgling class of crypto that feasts on risk is outshining a wider market paralyzed by war and inflation.

With an all-cash $43 billion offer to buy Twitter Inc , Musk may soon emulate the tycoons of the past by controlling a media platform that contributed to his rise to fame.

title: Last-minute tax tips for U.S. crypto investors
subheadlines: When accountant Zach Gordon gets calls from clients about how to handle cryptocurrency on their taxes, there is a common theme.

title: Bitcoin falls 5.3% to $39,881

subheadlines: Hackers have stolen cryptocurrency worth almost $615 million from a blockchain project linked to the popular online game Axie Infinity, in the latest cyberheist to hit the digital asset sector.

title: Dollar eases, euro rises on Ukraine peace talk hopes
subheadlines: The dollar fell against a basket of peer currencies on Tuesday as reports of progress in peace talks between Russia and Ukraine lifted the euro and reduced the safe-haven appeal of the greenback.

title: Cryptoverse: Remember when bitcoin was 'anonymous'?

title: Bitcoin climbs to highest in almost three weeks

title: Are cryptocurrencies securities? The SEC is answering the question
subheadlines: Roger E. Barton, Christopher J. McNamara and Michael C. Ward, of Barton LLP, discuss the growing regulatory scrutiny of cryptocurrencies and the analysis that addresses whether they are securities.

title: Global regulators monitor crypto use in Ukraine war

title: Euroclear joins bank-backed blockchain payment system

title: Be ready to lose all your money in crypto, EU regulators warn

title: Cryptoverse: Bitcoin's scared of commitment, Mr Biden
subheadlines: Bitcoin loves flirting with the mainstream. But now, as the U.S. president says he wants to get serious, it may be getting cold crypto feet.

title: How Wall Street star Cathie Wood is defying her doubters
subheadlines: Do you believe in Cathie Wood?

title: Dollar slips as traders eye Fed, Russia-Ukraine talks

title: Cryptoverse: The young HODLers keeping bitcoin on an even keel

title: EXCLUSIVE Russians liquidating crypto in the UAE as they seek safe havens

subheadlines: U.S. stock index futures cut some losses on Friday after data pointed to solid jobs growth in February, although lingering concerns about the Ukraine conflict weighed on sentiment.

title: Russia crisis is Big Crypto’s coming-of-age moment
subheadlines: Bitcoin’s creator, the mysterious Satoshi Nakamoto, envisaged an anonymous digital currency free from meddling intermediaries. Coinbase Global , Binance and other cryptocurrency exchanges are betting the exact opposite is true, and that they can stop their services becoming tools for sanctions evasion. They may pull it off.

title: Ukraine to unveil NFTs to support military as crypto funding push continues
subheadlines: Ukraine will unveil plans for NFTs to support its armed forces, its vice-prime minister said on Thursday, the latest move in Kyiv's efforts to raise funds in crypto assets after Russia invaded the country last week.

subheadlines: Bitcoin has leapt since Russia's invasion of Ukraine, bolstered by people in those countries looking to store and move money in anonymous and decentralised crypto.

title: Stablecoins gain as bitcoin, ether fall after Russia invades Ukraine

title: Cryptocurrencies fall after Russia invades Ukraine

title: Bitcoin’s true colours shine in stampede to safety
subheadlines: Adversity tends to reveal true character. It’s certainly doing so for bitcoin. A rocky period for equities this year and the more recent escalation of geopolitical tensions are making it clearer that cryptocurrency is neither a decent hedge against a slumping stock market nor a gold-like refuge.

title: Dollar dips in choppy trade as investors weigh Ukraine scenarios
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar dipped slightly against a basket of major currencies on Tuesday amid choppy trade spurred by developments in Ukraine after Russian President Vladimir Putin recognized two breakaway regions in the country and ordered troops to the area.

title: Cryptoverse: Bitcoin could be laid low by miners' malady
subheadlines: Bitcoin miners are feeling the heat - and the pain's rippling downstream to pressure prices.

title: Euro' gains fizzle as Russia-Ukraine conflict fears intensify

title: Cryptoverse: Bitcoin runs into Russian rules and regiments

title: Global regulators going 'full steam' to tame crypto currencies

title: Spending bitcoin is harder than stealing it
subheadlines: Stealing cryptocurrencies is relatively easy. The hard part is turning the proceeds into cash. That’s the lesson from the arrest on Tuesday of Ilya “Dutch” Lichtenstein and his wife Heather Morgan, an artist and rapper also known as Razzlekahn. The pair face charges of conspiring to launder bitcoin stolen from a virtual exchange in 2016. Yet six years later the U.S. Justice Department was still able to seize unspent tokens worth $3.6 billion.

title: Self-proclaimed 'Crocodile of Wall Street' snagged in big Bitcoin bust
subheadlines: Heather Morgan is a would-be corporate influencer who raps about entrepreneurship, designs handbags inspired by ketchup squirts, and signs off from her motivational YouTube videos with the words "razzle-dazzle."

title: Canada's TMX Group plans cryptocurrency futures product for institutional investors

title: Cryptoverse: After bitcoin 'winter', investors hunt risk in virtual worlds

title: U.S. SEC delays decision on Grayscale's spot bitcoin ETF

subheadlines: The party is over for technology start-ups rushing to go public at ever-higher valuations, as volatile U.S. stock markets have dampened investor appetite for high-growth stocks.

title: Cedar Fair, PG&E Corp, Chevron Corp

title: Reddit co-founder Ohanian's venture capital firm raises $500 mln
subheadlines: Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian said on Tuesday his venture capital firm 776 Management LLC has raised more than $500 million across two new funds.

title: Exxon Mobil, Xometry, Gannett

title: CRYPTOVERSE-Bitcoin squeezes smaller rivals to its crown

title: China selects pilot zones, application areas for blockchain project

title: Thai cafe serves up crypto advice with coffee and cake

title: Canada's Wealthsimple aims for real-world cryptocurrency use as it looks beyond trading

title: Russian authorities draw up 'road map' to regulate cryptocurrencies -document

title: The Cryptoverse: Teenage bitcoin throws an interest rate tantrum

title: Yen falls to one-month low, sterling solidly higher on global recovery trade
subheadlines: The yen dropped to a new one-month low and sterling hit a six-week high in holiday-thin trading on Thursday, after investors overnight had turned back towards riskier currencies and equities.

title: Dollar dips in quiet holiday trading
subheadlines: The dollar edged lower in thin holiday trading on Wednesday, while the safe-haven yen touched a one-month low as investors looked beyond a surge in Omicron cases and favored riskier currencies.

title: Dollar inches up in thin holiday trading
subheadlines: The dollar firmed slightly in early Asian trade on Wednesday as a recent rally in shares showed signs of petering out, but holiday-thinned trading meant markets were showing little real direction.

title: Dollar firms in soft holiday trading, outlook bullish
subheadlines: The dollar inched up on Wednesday as a recent rally in shares showed signs of petering out, but holiday-thinned trading meant markets were showing little real direction.

title: Global stocks end mixed after record-setting session
subheadlines: European stocks rose on Tuesday while Wall Street shares closed mixed after another record-setting session in which investors shrugged off concerns over Omicron-driven travel disruptions and store closures.

title: Bitcoin falls 6.1 percent to $47,607
subheadlines: Bitcoin dropped 6.13% to $47,606.92 on Tuesday, losing $3,111.19 from its previous close.

title: Dollar lifted by safe-haven flows, Fed expectations
subheadlines: The dollar edged higher in thin trading on Tuesday, helped by safe-haven flowsas worries over the spread of COVID-19 sapped a multi-day rally in equity markets, and on expectations the Federal Reserve could raise interest rates as early as March.

title: Tencent Music, Baudax Bio, Novavax
subheadlines: The S&P 500 hit a record high on Tuesday as conviction in the U.S. economy helped investors shrug off concerns over Omicron-driven travel disruptions and store closures, following a four-day rally for U.S. stocks amid thin trading volumes.

title: LiveOne, Tesla, ADDvantage Technologies
subheadlines: The S&P 500 hovered around record highs on Tuesday as conviction in the U.S. economy helped investors shrug off concerns over Omicron-driven travel disruptions and store closures, and extended Wall Street's four-day rally amid thin trading volumes.

title: Apple, LiveOne, Tesla
subheadlines: The S&P 500 was on track to open at all-time highs on Tuesday, building on a record-setting rally amid thin trading volumes, with investors unshaken by Omicron-driven travel disruptions and store closures.

title: Apple, Flotek Industries, Tesla
subheadlines: The S&P 500 and Dow futures hit all-time highs on Tuesday, building on a record-setting rally amid thin trading volumes, with investors trying to shrug off the impact from Omicron-driven travel disruptions and store closures.

title: Asset bubbles? Champagne outfizzes Big Tech and bitcoin in 2021
subheadlines: You might be tempted to pop corks if you've invested in vintage champagne this year - the most coveted bottles have outperformed all major financial market assets, from Big Tech to bitcoin.

title: Fading Omicron concerns set up shares for weekly gain, dent dollar
subheadlines: Stock markets in Europe and Asia cemented gains in light holiday trade on Friday, while the safe-haven dollar eased on signs the Omicron variant would not significantly derail global economic growth.

title: Shares edge up, dollar set for worst week since Sept as Omicron fears ebb
subheadlines: Most Asian share markets edged higher on Friday and the safe-haven dollar was on the back foot, on signs the Omicron variant would not significantly derail global economic growth.

title: Thai c.bank to test retail digital currency later than planned
subheadlines: Thailand's central bank said on Friday it expects to test its retail central bank digital currency (CBDC) for the public in late 2022, later than planned, as an alternative payment option.

title: U.S. SEC rejects Valkyrie, Kryptoin bitcoin trusts
subheadlines: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission vetoed two proposals to offer bitcoin exchange-traded funds, dealing a blow to market participants who had hoped the agency would green light the effort after approving futures-backed bitcoin funds in October.

title: Dollar slips while Aussie and Norwegian crown outperform
subheadlines: The euro, Australian dollar and other currencies recovered against the U.S. dollar as traders turned more positive about the economic outlook on Wednesday, even as Omicron cases rocketed and investors braced for more volatility.

title: Dollar slips as risk sentiment improves, Aussie outperforms
subheadlines: The euro, Australian dollar and other currencies recovered against the U.S. dollar as traders turned more positive about the economic outlook on Wednesday, even as Omicron cases rocketed and investors braced for more volatility.

title: U.S. stocks close up as Omicron fears fall; 'Santa Claus rally' may be muted
subheadlines: U.S. stock indexes closed broadly higher on Wednesday after investors cheered positive economic data and the White House said it was resuming talks on a massive social spending and climate change bill with a holdout senator.

title: Dollar out of favour as Omicron leaves currency markets unseasonably volatile
subheadlines: The dollar edged down again in early Asia on Wednesday, starting a third successive session under pressure as investors favoured riskier currencies and asset classes.

title: Boost for blockchain in China as Xinhua to issue photos as NFTs
subheadlines: The official Xinhua news agency said on Wednesday it will issue a digital media photo collection via non-fungible tokens (NFTs), a first for China and a boost for the blockchain technology that underpins them and that Beijing has previously criticised.

title: RPT-Global Markets in 2021: Recoveries, reflation and wrecking balls
subheadlines: For global financial markets, the second year of the COVID pandemic has been nearly as dramatic as the first.

title: Dollar regains ground as volatility starts to fade
subheadlines: The Aussie and Kiwi dollars on Wednesday, gave up some of their gains from the day before, as a rally in riskier asset classes began to lose steam, though moves were muted as traders started to head out for the holidays.

title: Global stocks rise sharply with investors' renewed risk appetite; oil settles up
subheadlines: Wall Street closed significantly higher on Tuesday after a bruising session the prior day, with oil prices also gaining as investors sought riskier assets despite surging cases of the Omicron coronavirus variant around the world.

title: Dollar slips as risk-sensitive currencies advance
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar dipped slightly on Tuesday as improving risk sentiment boosted riskier currencies such as the Australian dollar and the British pound.

title: Dollar firm as risk-sensitive currencies advance
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar steadied on Tuesday, recovering after a bout of profit-taking in the previous session, but its gains were held in check as improving risk sentiment boosted riskier currencies such as the Australian dollar and the British pound.

title: U.S. files action to return $150 Million in alleged embezzled funds to Sony
subheadlines: The United States filed a civil forfeiture complaint on Monday to return more than $154 million in funds that were allegedly stolen from a subsidiary of Tokyo-based Sony Corp and then seized by law enforcement during the FBI’s investigation of the theft, the U.S. Justice Department said.

title: EXCLUSIVE Turkey's cryptocurrency trades top 1 million a day amid lira woes
subheadlines: The number of cryptocurrency trades in Turkey has surged back above one million per day as the country's currency has plunged to a series of record lows, data shared with Reuters showed.

title: Global stocks gain as appetite for risk stages comeback
subheadlines: World shares gained on Tuesday as investors weighed up the extent to which the Omicron coronavirus variant would hit economies around the world, with the dollar softening as appetite for riskier assets made a cautious return.

title: 'Has anyone seen Web3?' Musk, Dorsey mock tech's latest buzzword
subheadlines: Billionaires Elon Musk and Jack Dorsey dismissed the so-called Web3 and criticized the involvement of venture capital firms such as Andreessen Horowitz in building out what some have called the next phase of the internet.

title: Canada’s weed lead is running out of puff
subheadlines: Canada often has little choice but to bend to the heftier market forces of its neighbor to the south. The cannabis business was an exception after Ottawa legalized weed in 2018 and gave Canadian companies a lead. They've been angling for a stake in the larger U.S. market. But they need to act soon to make the most of the remaining early legalization buzz.

title: Dollar on back foot as Treasury yields soften, Omicron keeps markets on edge
subheadlines: The dollar hovered below recent highs on Tuesday having lost ground overnight after a blow to Democratic spending plans in Washington, but worries about the Omicron coronavirus variant kept risk currencies in check.

title: Dollar consolidates as risk appetite recovers; lira rockets
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar recouped some overnight losses and the euro edged higher on Tuesday as risk sentiment recovered partially after a selloff in global markets.

title: Dollar on back foot but Omicron keeps markets on edge
subheadlines: The dollar softened a little on Tuesday in the wake of improving market appetite for risk assets and currencies, extending its overnight losses following a blow to Democratic spending plans in Washington.

title: Dollar weakens as Treasury yields slip; Omicron worries linger
subheadlines: The dollar edged lower on Monday as traders sent midterm U.S. Treasury yields lower following a blow to prospects for approval of Democratic climate and social spending legislation in Washington and on concerns about the continued spread of the Omicron coronavirus variant.

title: Russian cenbank official: We see no room for cryptocurrencies
subheadlines: Bank of Russia Deputy Governor Vladimir Chistyukhin hinted on Monday that privately run cryptocurrencies may soon no longer be used in the country's financial markets, TASS news agency reported.

title: From metaverse to DAOs, a guide to 2021's tech buzzwords
subheadlines: This year, tech CEOs drew inspiration from a 1990s sci-fi novel, Reddit investors' lexicon seeped into the mainstream as "diamond hands" and "apes" shook Wall Street, and something called a DAO tried to buy a rare copy of the U.S. Constitution.

title: U.S. SEC delays decision on Grayscale's spot bitcoin ETF
subheadlines: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has delayed its decision on a spot bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF) proposal from Grayscale Bitcoin Trust, the world's largest digital currency manager.

title: Dollar jumps as Omicron spreads amid rate-hike talk
subheadlines: The dollar rose on Friday as traders retreated from riskier currencies amid talk of interest rate hikes by central bankers and concerns about the spread of Omicron cases.

title: Dollar climbs on risk-off moves as Omicron, rate-hike talk spread
subheadlines: The dollar rose on Friday as traders retreated from riskier currencies amid talk of interest rate hikes by central bankers and concerns about the spread of Omicron cases.

title: Mexican retailer Grupo Elektra embraces bitcoin for payments
subheadlines: Mexico's Grupo Elektra will accept bitcoin as payment for purchases, the latest retailer in Latin America to embrace the cryptocurrency as it grows in popularity.

title: Dollar rises as markets digest central bank news, look to year-end
subheadlines: The dollar rose on Friday as markets approached the end of a busy week in which major central banks laid out plans to unwind pandemic-era stimulus.

title: Beijing rule changes to revive China's IPO prospects in 2022, bankers say
subheadlines: Greater China's flagging initial public offerings (IPOs) are set to get a fillip in 2022 from the expected unveiling of new rules by Beijing for Chinese firms' offshore listings, giving clarity to jittery investors, investment bankers and analysts said.

title: No, Twitter not a valid way to serve a crypto suit on Binance execs, judge rules
subheadlines: Yi He, a cofounder of the cryptocurrency exchange Binance Capital Management Co. Ltd, has a little joke in her Twitter bio: She lists her location as Mars. Binance’s chief growth officer, Ted Lin, identifies his location on Twitter as “decentralized.” Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao doesn’t include any location at all in his Twitter profile.

title: Dollar steadies after fall triggered by central bank moves
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar steadied on Thursday but was headed toward a second day of losses as markets sorted a raft of central bank policy statements for clues to coming differences in interest rates and support for their economies.

title: Dollar falls for second day as markets sort central bank moves
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar fell for a second day on Thursday as markets moved toward risk while sorting a raft of central bank policy statements for clues to coming differences in interest rates and economic strength.

title: Russian central bank to seek ban on investment in cryptocurrencies
subheadlines: The Russian central bank wants to ban investments in cryptocurrencies in Russia, seeing risks to financial stability in the rising number of crypto transactions, two financial market sources close to the bank said.

title: Salvadoran drag queen emerges as a colorful presidential critic
subheadlines: Promoting bitcoin as he consolidates power, El Salvador's popular President Nayib Bukele has mostly swatted away his traditional political opponents with ease. But a new critic in colorful wigs and platform heels has proven harder to ignore.

title: French unicorn Voodoo to invest $200 mln in blockchain mobile games
subheadlines: French mobile game maker Voodoo, which is backed by Goldman Sachs and Chinese tech giant Tencent , said on Thursday it will invest $200 million in 2022 on studios that develop blockchain-based mobile video games.

title: Dollar holds tight as investors look beyond Fed to next big cenbank meetings
subheadlines: The dollar paused for breath on Thursday, having given up a brief rally made after the U.S Federal Reserve said it would end pandemic-era bond purchases in March, as investors awaited imminent decisions from other major central banks.

title: Dollar turns down in risk-on pivot as Fed chair talks policy
subheadlines: Traders embraced and then turned way from the U.S. dollar on Wednesday as initial enthusiasm for higher interest rates from the Federal Reserve turned into confidence to take more risk with stocks and other currencies.

title: Dollar steady, currency markets quiet as investors wait for Fed
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar held firm on Wednesday, with currency markets quiet as investors waited to see if the U.S. Federal Reserve would reinforce market expectations for rate hikes next year.

title: Majority of Salvadorans approve of Bukele's leadership, poll shows
subheadlines: A strong majority of Salvadorans approve of President Nayib Bukele's government despite controversies over his policies and U.S. sanctions on his cabinet, according to a poll by the investigative unit of local newspaper La Prensa published Wednesday.

title: Dollar trades narrowly as markets wait for word from the Fed
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar held recent gains in narrow trading on Wednesday as markets awaited a Federal Reserve policy statement later in the day to affirm, or upset, expectations for interest rate hikes in the new year.

title: Dollar holds firm as investors eye major Fed policy meeting
subheadlines: The dollar held its recent gains in early Asia trading on Wednesday as investors looked towards a key Federal Reserve policy meeting to see if it would reinforce growing market expectations for earlier rate rises next year.

title: Dollar stands firm as investors eye major Fed policy meeting
subheadlines: The dollar held its recent gains in Asian trading on Wednesday as investors looked towards a key Federal Reserve policy meeting to see if it would reinforce growing market expectations for earlier and additional rate rises next year.

title: Dollar climbs again ahead of Fed and ECB meetings
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar rose again on Tuesday after rebounding from a dip that nearly wiped out its gains from the day before as markets jostled with the different paths major central banks are choosing between fighting inflation or the economic drag of the pandemic.

title: Dollar near one-week high on expectation of hawkish Fed
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar stayed near one-week highs on Tuesday versus a basket of major currencies,as data showing factory gate inflation at 11-year highs confirmed market expectations of a faster taper pace at this week's Federal Reserve meeting.

title: Ark's Cathie Wood remains concerned about deflation, not inflation
subheadlines: Star stock picker Cathie Wood of Ark Invest struck a defiant tone in a webinar Tuesday in which she repeated her warning that deflation, rather than inflation, will be the largest risk for financial markets and the economy in the year ahead.

title: Bitcoin company NYDIG valued at $7 bln after latest fund raising
subheadlines: NYDIG said on Tuesday it raised $1 billion in a funding round led by venture firm WestCap with participation from existing investor Bessemer Venture Partners, valuing the bitcoin company at more than $7 billion.

title: Tesla to accept dogecoin as payment for merchandise, says Musk
subheadlines: Tesla Inc chief Elon Musk said on Tuesday the electric carmaker will accept dogecoin as payment for merchandise on a test basis, sending the meme-based cryptocurrency up over 20%.

title: Dollar firms after a dip as markets weigh rate policies, coronavirus
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar was down slightly on Tuesday after coming back from a dip that nearly wiped out its gains from the day before as markets jostled with the different paths major central banks will choose to fight inflation and the pandemic's economic drag.

title: BHP completes first blockchain copper concentrate trade with Minmetals
subheadlines: Miner BHP Group has completed a $30 million blockchain trade in copper concentrate with China Minmetals Corp, online platform MineHub said on Tuesday.

title: Investors raise cash on hawkish central banks worries
subheadlines: Investors raised cash allocations to 5.1% on growing concerns over central bank hawkishness, BofA Securities' monthly fund manager survey showed before key policy decisions this week by the U.S. Federal Reserve and other big central banks.

title: Dollar near one-week high amid hawkish Fed hopes, Omicron fears
subheadlines: The dollar traded near a one-week high versus a basket of major rivals on Tuesday, supported by expectations of a hawkish Federal Reserve meeting this week and haven demand amid continued uncertainty about the Omicron coronavirus variant.

title: U.S. dollar advances as Fed seen concluding asset buys sooner than expected
subheadlines: The dollar rose on Monday ahead of a slew of central bank meetings this week led by the Federal Reserve, with investors expecting the U.S. central bank to announce it will wrap up its bond purchases sooner than expected, as they look for clues on timing of interest rate increases next year.

title: BoE's Bailey tells banks to be 'especially cautious' with crypto
subheadlines: Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey warned banks and other regulated financial firms on Monday that they should be "especially cautious" about holding volatile cryptoassets until regulators put new rules in place.

title: Stablecoins steal the limelight from subdued bitcoin
subheadlines: As bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, struggles to recover after a massive crash, regulatory and private sector focus has turned to another part of the digital currency world: stablecoins.

title: Cryptocurrencies show net inflows last week despite price declines
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency products and funds posted net inflows of $88 million last week, data from digital asset manager CoinShares showed on Monday, amid a mixed investment flows picture in a week that saw a drop in prices.

title: Germany's trillion-euro savings banks mull crypto wallet
subheadlines: Germany's savings banks, a conservative bastion that holds more than 1 trillion euros for thrifty Germans, is looking into offering a wallet to trade cryptocurrency, a group of the banks said on Monday.

title: Take Five: Ready for a central bank bonanza?
subheadlines: It's a bumper week for central banks in the United States, the euro zone, Japan, Britain, Mexico and Russia. And will Turkey's central bank deliver more cuts?

title: Dollar on front foot ahead of busy week for central banks
subheadlines: The dollar inched higher at the start of a busy week of central bank meetings, including at the Federal Reserve, which are expected to drive currency markets and help the dollar, although concerns about the coronavirus weigh heavily on traders' minds.

title: Column: Volatility, Fed undermine Bitcoin's inflation hedge claim
subheadlines: With annual U.S. inflation running at its highest since 1982, now would be the perfect time for Bitcoin to stand up and cement its status as a 'real' asset, a store of value and the hedge against inflation its enthusiasts claim.

title: Dollar steady as traders wait for central banks, pound inches lower on COVID fears
subheadlines: The dollar was quiet at the start of a week in which central bank meetings, including by the Federal Reserve, will likely drive currency markets, while sterling fell slightly after Boris Johnson warned about the impact of the new COVID-19 variant.

title: Bitcoin rises 2.1% to reclaim $50,000
subheadlines: Bitcoin rose on Sunday to reclaim levels above $50,000.

title: Stocks rise as hot CPI data fails to unnerve investors
subheadlines: The dollar weakened and a gauge of global equity markets rose higher on Friday after data showed consumer prices rose as expected in November, easing concerns the U.S. Federal Reserve would aggressively tighten monetary policy to combat inflation.

title: U.S. dollar net longs skid in latest week -CFTC, Reuters data
subheadlines: Speculators' net long positioning on the U.S. dollar fell in the latest week, according to calculations by Reuters and U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission data released on Friday.

title: Softbank-backed Brazilian crypto company launches new venture unit
subheadlines: Softbank-backed Brazilian company 2TM, which runs the largest cryptocurrency exchange in Latin America, has launched a venture capital unit focusing on blockchain companies around the world, the company's chief executive officer said in an interview.

title: Dollar waits on CPI, yuan bounces back from policy knock
subheadlines: The dollar was firm on Friday as traders wagered U.S. inflation figures could settle the course of interest rate rises next year, while the Chinese yuan regained its footing after being knocked back by official policy.

title: Late filers to lead Bitcoin mining-machine class action
subheadlines: A federal judge in Manhattan on Thursday chose a Hong Kong couple to lead the securities-fraud lawsuit against Bitcoin mining machine manufacturer Canaan Inc even though they had filed the information to support their class leadership motion two weeks late.

subheadlines: The dollar was firm on Friday ahead of U.S. inflation figures, which could settle the course of interest rates, while the Chinese yuan was nursing its sharpest drop in months after a nudge lower from authorities triggered a slide.

title: Dollar gains, equity rally stalls as caution returns
subheadlines: World stock markets stalled at two-week highs and oil prices fell on Thursday as increased restrictions in parts of the world to contain the spread of the Omicron COVID-19 variant tempered investor optimism about the economic recovery.

title: Dollar higher as virus restrictions knock risk sentiment
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar rose against a basket of currencies on Thursday as increased restrictions in parts of the world to contain the spread of COVID-19, including the new Omicron variant, tempered investors' appetite for riskier currencies.

subheadlines: The dollar failed to pick up ground on most major peers on Thursday as markets saw optimism in early data hinting the Omicron variant of the new coronavirus may not be as bad as feared, even as new COVID-19 restrictions in Britain hurt the sterling.

title: Hope rally turns choppy as hot U.S. inflation looms
subheadlines: Stocks rose in choppy trade on Thursday as worries about the economic impact of the Omicron coronavirus variant ebbed but increasing caution ahead of U.S. inflation data capped other risk assets such as oil and the Australian dollar.

title: Euro, dollar steady with Omicron fears and central bank moves in focus
subheadlines: The euro, sterling and dollar stabilised on Thursday amid hopes some COVID-19 vaccines might be able to neutralise new coronavirus variant Omicron. Analysts said the focus was shifting back to monetary policy.

title: Dollar stays soft with Omicron and Fed top of mind
subheadlines: This week's rally in risk-friendly assets and currencies like the Australian dollar petered out on Thursday, but the U.S. dollar struggled to regain its lost ground as investors waited for a key Federal Reserve policy meeting due next week.

title: Cryptocurrency expert tells court IRS 'fishing expedition' violates privacy rights
subheadlines: A federal appeals court on Wednesday signaled it may allow a bitcoin user to challenge the Internal Revenue Service's seizure of his financial information from Coinbase Global Inc and other virtual currency exchanges, in a case that could have broad implications for cryptocurrency tax probes.

title: Visa launches crypto advisory service for financial institutions, merchants

title: Bulls take charge as Omicron concerns ease

title: Aussie rallies on improved risk appetite
subheadlines: Easing Omicron COVID-19 variant worries and a timely booster shot of Chinese stimulus helped lift riskier currencies on Tuesday with the Australian dollar leading the charge.

subheadlines: The dollar was supported against other safe-haven currencies such as the Japanese yen on Tuesday, hanging on to a jump made with U.S. yields, as investors hoped early signs the Omicron variant may be mild will be proved correct.

title: Bitcoin falls 9.2% to $48,782
subheadlines: Bitcoin dropped 9.29% to $48,752.15 at 22:01 GMT on Saturday, losing $4,991.54 from its previous close.

title: Bitcoin falls by a fifth, cryptos see $1 billion worth liquidated
subheadlines: Bitcoin shed a fifth of its value on Saturday as a combination of profit-taking and macro-economic concerns triggered nearly a billion dollars worth of selling across cryptocurrencies.

title: Bitcoin falls 8.4% to $49,228.82
subheadlines: Bitcoin dropped 8.4% to $49,228.82 at 20:01 GMT on Saturday, losing $4,514.87 from its previous close.

title: Bitcoin tumbles 9.95% to $48,397.56
subheadlines: Bitcoin dropped 9.95% to $48,397.56 at 18:02 GMT on Saturday, losing $5,346.13 from its previous close.

title: Bitcoin tumbles 5.5% to $53,436
subheadlines: Bitcoin plunged 5.5% to $53,435.9 at 22:04 GMT on Friday, losing $3,112.06 from its previous close.

title: Stocks, yields slide after U.S. jobs report as Omicron looms
subheadlines: Global equities and benchmark U.S. bond yields tumbled on Friday in volatile trade after data showed U.S. job growth slowed considerably in November and the Omicron variant of the coronavirus kept investors on edge.

title: U.S. dollar net longs jump to highest since mid-June 2019 - CFTC, Reuters data
subheadlines: Speculators' net long positioning on the U.S. dollar in the latest week soared to its highest level since mid-June 2019, according to calculations by Reuters and U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission data released on Friday.

title: Notable quotes from the Reuters Next conference
subheadlines: Reuters Next is hosting three days of interviews, panels and presentations with 150+ global leaders discussing the biggest business, social and environmental challenges for the year ahead.

title: PayPal says 'buy now, pay later' volumes surged 400% on Black Friday
subheadlines: Volumes on PayPal Inc's 'buy now, pay later' platform were five times higher this Black Friday compared with a year earlier as the payments giant starts to gain traction in the fast-growing credit method, the company's chief executive told the Reuters Next conference.

title: Britain's ETC Group to list crypto products on Deutsche Boerse
subheadlines: Britain's ETC Group said on Thursday it will this month list five new "exchange traded cryptocurrencies" at the Frankfurt stock exchange, adding to the glut of exchange-traded products at European exchanges.

title: Dorsey-led Square rebrands to Block in nod to blockchain
subheadlines: Square Inc , the payments company led by Twitter Inc co-founder Jack Dorsey, said on Wednesday it was changing its name to Block Inc, as it looks to expand beyond its payment business and into new technologies like blockchain.

title: Former Ubiquiti employee charged with hacking, extorting company
subheadlines: A former employee of New York-based Ubiquiti Inc was arrested Wednesday on charges of stealing confidential data from the wireless technology company and using it to demand nearly $2 million in ransom, federal prosecutors said.

title: Dollar recovers in face of Omicron; commodity currencies slide
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar recovered from a loss on Wednesday after reports the Omicron coronavirus variant is spreading and oil prices turned down, hurting commodity currencies.

title: Dollar falls; yen and Swiss franc gain in post-Omicron gyrations
subheadlines: The U.S. dollar fell on Wednesday morning in trading that saw the safe-haven yen and Swiss franc appreciate even as the risk-on British and Australian currencies rebounded from lows the day before.

title: Dollar steadies, risk currencies recover from Omicron-driven drop
subheadlines: The dollar steadied on Wednesday and risk appetite recovered somewhat, but euro-dollar volatility remained elevated as investors weighed up hawkish comments from the Federal Reserve and risks relating to the Omicron variant.

title: Thai central bank says doesn't support digital assets as payments
subheadlines: Thailand's central bank on Wednesday warned companies about accepting digital assets as payment for goods and services, as more companies rolled out partnerships to accept major cryptocurrencies as payment.

title: Croatia's top food retailer introduces payment in cryptocurrencies
subheadlines: Croatia's largest food retailer, Konzum, said on Wednesday that from this month it had introduced an option of paying with cryptocurrencies in its online shops to be the first local retailer offering the payment service.

title: Haven currencies ebb with Omicron fears
subheadlines: Riskier currencies bounced from recent lows and safe-havens such as the yen eased against the dollar on Wednesday as traders in Asia lightened some of their worries about the Omicron variant.

title: Jack Dorsey chases crypto, fintech dream post Twitter
subheadlines: At a packed Miami conference in June, Jack Dorsey, mused in front of thousands of attendees about where his real passion lay: "If I weren't at Square or Twitter, I'd be working on bitcoin."

title: Yen, Swiss franc rally on global outlook risks after hawkish Powell
subheadlines: The safe-haven yen and Swiss Franc gained on Tuesday, with risk appetite plummeting, as investors grew nervous about a suddenly hawkish Federal Reserve that could deliver aggressive rate hikes and derail a nascent economic recovery.

title: Bitcoin miner Griid Infrastructure to go public via $3.3 bln SPAC deal
subheadlines: Bitcoin miner Griid Infrastructure said on Tuesday it would go public by merging with blank-check firm Adit EdTech Acquisition Corp in a deal valuing the combined company at about $3.3 billion, including debt.

title: Didi, MEI Pharma, TG Therapeutics, Cumberland Pharma
subheadlines: Wall Street's main indexes tumbled more than 1% on Tuesday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said the risk of higher inflation has increased and that it was appropriate to consider wrapping up tapering of bond purchases a few months sooner.

title: Facebook, Tesla, Regeneron Pharma, ImmunoGen
subheadlines: Wall Street's main indexes were set to fall sharply on Tuesday after a warning from vaccine maker Moderna's chief executive on the effectiveness of COVID-19 shots against the Omicron variant hammered travel, energy and banking shares.

title: Euro on track for biggest three-day rising streak of 2021
subheadlines: The euro surged on Tuesday and was on track for its biggest three-day rising streak this year, as traders cut their short positions on the single currency after Moderna's CEO said COVID-19 vaccines were unlikely to be as effective against the Omicron variant as they have been with other types.

title: Speculators' net long U.S. dollar bets hit six-week high -CFTC, Reuters data
subheadlines: Speculators' net long bets on the U.S. dollar rose to the highest level since mid-October in the latest week, according to calculations by Reuters and U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission data released on Monday.

title: Jack Dorsey leaves one company, helps out two
subheadlines: Jack Dorsey’s departure from one of the companies he created helps both of them. The Twitter founder stepped down as chief executive on Monday, making room for Chief Technology Officer Parag Agrawal to provide some strategic direction for the $38 billion social network. Dorsey can pay more attention to his other company, financial technology firm Square , which is facing more competition.

title: U.S. dollar rises; yen, Swiss franc skid as Omicron worries ebb
subheadlines: The dollar firmed on Monday while the safe-haven yen and Swiss franc weakened, reversing some of Friday's moves as governments around the world sought further information on the most recent mutation and its impact.

title: Cryptocurrencies post record inflows in first 11 months -CoinShares
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency products and funds posted record inflows in the first 11 months of the year, as institutional investors flocked into the space despite price declines in the last few weeks, data from digital asset manager CoinShares showed on Monday.

title: Analysis: Amid Bukele's bitcoin hype, not all Salvadorans 'Feel the Bit'
subheadlines: El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele took the stage last weekend at the end of "Bitcoin Week" to the cheers of fans delighted his Central American country has become the first to adopt crypto currency as legal tender, alongside the U.S. dollar.

title: Cryptocurrencies brace for winter, virtual Adidas and a bitcoin city
subheadlines: Cryptocurrencies survived one of the largest market shocks since the earliest days of the pandemic last week, with El Salvador a notable dip buyer, while investors decided not to share Adidas' excitement over a foray into the buzzy metaverse.

title: 'Omicron' the cryptocurrency rides new variant rollercoaster
subheadlines: As global markets fell last week on news of the new Omicron coronavirus variant, one cryptocurrency with the same name soared after the Greek letter entered the investor lexicon.

title: Dollar wobbles, currencies partly pull back on Omicron shock moves
subheadlines: The dollar strengthened then dipped in early European trading on Monday, the euro fell and the yen steadied, as currency markets reversed some of Friday's moves, calming somewhat after the initial shock over the new variant of COVID-19.

title: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinstore enters India despite pending curbs on trade
subheadlines: Singapore-based virtual currency exchange Coinstore has begun operations in India at a time when the Indian government is preparing legislation to effectively bar most private cryptocurrencies.

title: Bukele says El Salvador 'bought the dip' and purchased 100 extra bitcoins
subheadlines: El Salvador President Nayib Bukele on Friday said his country had bought an additional 100 bitcoins after the digital currency declined in value, building on the country's cryptocurrency stake despite vast criticism about the government's strategy.

title: Cryptocurrencies tumble as coronavirus variant shakes markets
subheadlines: Bitcoin tumbled over 9% on Friday, dragging smaller tokens down, after the discovery of a new, potentially vaccine-resistant coronavirus variant saw investors dump riskier assets for the perceived safety of bonds, the yen and the dollar.

title: Dollar slips below 16-month highs as trade winds down for Thanksgiving
subheadlines: The dollar slipped slightly on Thursday but was still close to its highest since July 2020 against the euro, having strengthened due to market expectations that the U.S. Federal Reserve will raise rates sooner than other major central banks.

title: Salvadoran bond spreads hit record as crypto bet threatens IMF deal
subheadlines: Salvadoran bond prices fell between 1 and 2 cents on Tuesday and spreads to U.S. Treasuries widened to a record above 1,200 basis points as investors assess the country's turn away from orthodoxy and towards crypto-based funding.

title: Dollar steadies near 16-month high; New Zealand dollar weakens
subheadlines: The dollar index held near 16-month highs on Tuesday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell was picked for a second term, reinforcing market expectations that U.S. interest rates will rise in 2022.

title: Dollar steady, euro recovers on better than expected data
subheadlines: The dollar index held near 16-month highs on Tuesday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell was picked for a second term, reinforcing market expectations that U.S. interest rates will rise in 2022.

title: India seeks to block most cryptocurrencies in new bill, government says
subheadlines: India is looking to bar most private cryptocurrencies when it introduces a new bill to regulate virtual currencies in the winter session of Parliament, the government said late on Tuesday.

title: Dollar gains, euro recovers on better than expected data
subheadlines: The dollar index held near 16-month highs on Tuesday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell was picked for a second term, reinforcing market expectations that U.S. interest rates will rise in 2022.

title: China tells Alibaba, Baidu cloud units to better prevent telecoms fraud
subheadlines: China's industry ministry on Tuesday said its cyberspace administration and police had summoned the cloud units of Alibaba and Baidu Inc to urge them to better prevent telecom network fraud.

title: Dollar stands tall as Powell reappointment firms hawkish Fed bets
subheadlines: The dollar was near a four-and-a-half-year top against the yen on Tuesday, after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell was reappointed for a second term, emboldening bets on higher U.S. interest rates.

subheadlines: The dollar hit a new four-and-a-half-year top against the yen on Tuesday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell was renominated for a second term, reinforcing bets that U.S. interest rates would rise next year and diverge from Japan's.

subheadlines: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Monday said El Salvador should not use bitcoin as legal tender, considering risks related to the cryptocurrency.

subheadlines: Los Angeles Rams newly-acquired wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr. will receive his total salary from the Rams in bitcoin, he said on Monday, making him the latest NFL star to ask to be paid in the cryptocurrency.

title: Wall Street retreats from records, U.S. Treasury yields rise
subheadlines: Wall Street retreated from record highs on Monday, and shares of lenders rallied as two-year U.S. Treasury yields rose after President Joe Biden tapped Jerome Powell to continue as Federal Reserve chair.

subheadlines: Cyrptocurrency products and funds posted inflows in the latest week, with investors undeterred by the latest price corrections, weekly data from digital asset manager CoinShares showed on Monday.

subheadlines: Wall Street shares rose to record levels on Monday and European stocks turned higher after U.S. President Joe Biden picked Jerome Powell to continue as Federal Reserve chair, in a move welcomed as a signal of stability by global investors.

title: U.S. official says El Salvador relations 'paused' for lack of interest
subheadlines: Relations between El Salvador and the United States are temporarily on hold due to the Salvadoran government's apparent lack of interest in dialogue, the senior U.S. official in the Central American country said on Monday.

subheadlines: Cryptocurrency startup MoonPay has raised fresh capital from investors led by Tiger Global Management and hedge fund Coatue at a valuation of $3.4 billion, becoming the latest venture to capitalize on sky-high investor demand for rapidly growing companies in the sector.

subheadlines: World stocks kicked off the week on a cautious note on Monday after posting a second consecutive weekly drop, and the euro struggled as traders weighed the risks of European lockdown restrictions and prospects of a faster Federal Reserve taper.

title: El Salvador plans first 'Bitcoin City', backed by bitcoin bonds
subheadlines: El Salvador plans to build the world's first "Bitcoin City", funded initially by bitcoin-backed bonds, President Nayib Bukele said on Saturday, doubling down on his bet to harness the crypto currency to fuel investment in the Central American country.

title: Oil and euro slip, markets on edge over COVID-19 curbs in Europe
subheadlines: Asian stocks made a soft start to the week on Monday while oil and the euro were under pressure, as the return of COVID-19 restrictions in Europe and talk about hastened tapering from the U.S. Federal Reserve put investors on guard.

title: Dollar shines, euro suffers as COVID fears flare over Europe
subheadlines: The safe-haven U.S. dollar traded close to a 16-month high to the euro on Monday on growing anxiety over the impact of surging COVID-19 infections in Europe, with Austria reimposing a full lockdown and Germany considering following suit.

title: Dollar solid, euro suffers on growing concerns about Europe's COVID situation
subheadlines: The safe-haven U.S. dollar traded close to a 16-month high to the euro on Monday on growing anxiety over the impact of surging COVID-19 infections in Europe, with Austria reimposing a full lockdown and Germany considering following suit.

subheadlines: Stocks made a wobbly start to the week while oil and the euro were under pressure on Monday, as the return of COVID-19 restrictions in Europe and talk about hastened tapering from the U.S. Federal Reserve put investors on guard.

title: Dollar rises as COVID concerns spark flight to safety
subheadlines: The dollar rose on Friday as investors sought safe havens after Austria said it would be the first country in Western Europe to reimpose a full lockdown amid surging COVID-19 infections and Germany said it could follow suit, sending the euro lower.

title: Near-term indicators point to a breather for bitcoin
subheadlines: Cryptocurrency market indicators such as average bitcoin funding rates, inflows into crypto investment products and the ratio of old-to-new coins being sold suggest a near-term consolidation for the sector and lower odds of a year-end rally bitcoin bulls are predicting.

subheadlines: The dollar was on track for a fourth straight week of gains against major rival currencies on Friday, as traders wager on interest rates rising faster in the United States amid surging inflation around the world.
